chunks.original_text: 不求大道出迷涂，纵负贤才岂丈夫。 百岁光阴石火烁，一生身世水泡浮。 只贪利禄求荣显，不顾形容暗悴枯。 试问堆金等山岳，无常买得不来无。 二 人生虽有百年期，寿夭穷通莫预知。 昨日街头犹走马，今朝棺内已眠尸。 妻财遗下非君有，罪业将行难自欺。 大药不求争得遇，遇之不炼是愚痴。 右二章真人以此感悟世人，惟恐或后，故列之於首。 三 学仙须是学天仙，叶士表曰：仙有千种，天仙者形神俱妙，与道合真，聚则成形，散则成气。 学此道者当内外虚明，表裹莹彻，如立一尘，则成渗漏。 惟有金丹最的端。 李荃曰：还丹之衍百数，此谓金丹者，金液大还丹也。 《参同契》曰：金来归性初，乃得称还丹。 盖金为药母，金吐其液复还丹田，谓之金液还丹也。 魏师吕《先天大学书》曰：夫金丹者，先天一气之祖，后天而生两仪三才，万物之母。 《易》曰：乾元者，始而亨者也。 万物资之以始，能以美利利天下，而不言所利者，有刚健中正纯粹之德，功 成退位居偏。 乾居亥位，寄体北方水中，坎之中爻是也。 圣人能返而归根复命，与元神道合，生生无穷，总括万象，谓之得一，故强名曰丹，非法衍也。 是乾道变化，阴阳不测之谓也。 象易太极无上至真之妙，包含性命之宗。 《内易》曰：中爻之义，是谓造化。 《金碧经》曰：神室者，丹之枢辖，在坎离一二数。 《参同契》曰：金来归性初，乃得称还丹。 谓之金液归真，形神俱妙之道，至简至易，．一得永得。 所以万论千经，能变化自然生神，得其口诀，虽至愚小人，立跻圣位。 是以天机秘惜，不许授之非人，轻泄妄传， 殃及九祖。 是知金丹者无上至真之径路也。 黄帝修之以登云天，后世成真合道，顿超生死，尽因金丹而成。 真人曰：屈指从今飞步者，尽因金液出尘寰，即此义也。 二物会时情性合，五行全处虎龙蟠。 真一子曰：金者，情也； 水者，性也。 金生於水，犹情生於性，水隐於金，犹情复於性，或曰金为母，何得谓之情邪？ 而《参同契》曰：金为水母，母隐子者是也。 交会则金水混融，全聚则虎龙蟠结，故下章云：既驱二物归黄道，争得灵丹不解生 《参同契》曰：坎为水为月，在人为肾。 肾脏生精，精中有正阳之气，炎升于上，精阴气阳，故铅柔而银　　刚。 虎性属金，而金能生水，颠倒取之，母隐子胎，故虎向水中生也。 虎乃配铅，阴中之阳也。 离为火，为日，在人为心。 心脏生血中，有真一之液，流降于下，血阳液阴，故砂阳而汞阴。 龙性属木，而木能生火，颠倒取之，故母隐子胎，龙从火裹出也。 龙亦配汞，阳中之阴也。 本因戊己为媒娉，遂使夫妻镇合欢。 叶士表曰：坎离纳戊己，戊己坎离中气。 言前二物因中气升降，生成配合也。 无名子曰：戊己属土，谓之黄婆。 龙虎，金木间隔，束西，黄婆使之会合，岂非媒娉乎？ 只候功成朝北阙，九霞光裹驾祥鸾。 只候功成朝北关，九霞光裹驾祥惊。 四 此法真中妙更真，都绿我独异於人。 自知颠倒由离坎，谁识浮沉定主宾。 叶士表曰：五位相得，而名有合，乾纳甲壬一九成十，坤纳乙癸四六成十，艮丙震庚三七成十，巽辛兑丁二八成十，坎离戊己共得十五。 颠倒上下不变，所以颠倒升降皆由之也。
chunks.translated_text:
Do not seek the Great Dao to escape the maze of delusion—
Even with worthy talent, how can one be a true man?
A hundred years of light flash like sparks from stone,
A lifetime’s fate floats like bubbles on water.
Only coveting profit and rank, seeking glory and display,
Heedless of the body’s form withering in silent decay.
Try asking: though gold be piled like mountains,
Can impermanence be bought to never come?

II
Though human life may span a hundred years,
Longevity or early death, poverty or success—none can foreknow.
Yesterday he rode a horse through the streets,
Today his corpse lies still within the coffin.
Wealth and wives left behind are not truly his,
The karmic deeds he carries deceive not even himself.
If the Great Elixir is not sought, how can one chance upon it?
To encounter it yet fail to refine it is utter folly.

These two chapters the Perfected One sets forth to awaken the world,
Lest any be left behind—thus they stand at the beginning.

III
To study immortality, one must study the immortality of Heaven.
Ye Shibiao says: Among the thousand kinds of immortals,
The Heavenly Immortal unites form and spirit in wondrous perfection,
Harmonizing with the Dao in truth.
When gathered, they take form; when dispersed, they become qi.
Those who cultivate this Way must make inner and outer void and luminous,
Transparent within and without.
Should even a speck of dust arise, leakage will occur.
Only the Golden Elixir is most certain and true.

Li Quan says: Though the refinements of the Returned Elixir number in the hundreds,
This is called the Golden Elixir—the Great Returned Elixir of Golden Fluid.
The *Cantong Qi* states: When gold returns to the original nature,
Only then is it called the Returned Elixir.
For gold is the mother of the medicine,
And when gold emits its fluid to return to the cinnabar field,
It is called the Golden Fluid Returned Elixir.

Master Wei Lü’s *Precelestial Great Learning* says:
The Golden Elixir is the ancestor of the primordial qi,
From which the postcelestial generates the Two Modes and the Three Powers,
The mother of the myriad things.
The *Book of Changes* says: Qian’s origin is that which begins and brings to fruition.
The myriad things rely on it to begin,
It bestows bountiful benefit upon the world yet does not speak of its beneficence.
Possessing the virtue of firmness, strength, centrality, and purity,
Its work complete, it retreats to a humble position.
Qian resides in the position of Hai,
Lodged within the body of northern water—
This is the central line of Kan.
The sage can return to the root and restore life,
Uniting with the primordial spirit and the Dao,
Endlessly generating—encompassing all images,
This is called “obtaining the One.”
Thus it is forcibly named “Elixir,” not an empty derivation.
This is the transformation of Qian’s Dao,
The unfathomable interplay of yin and yang.
It embodies the supreme, most true wonder of the Great Ultimate,
Encompassing the origin of nature and life.
The *Inner Book of Changes* says: The meaning of the central line is called creation and transformation.
The *Scripture of the Golden and Azure* says: The Spirit Chamber is the pivot of the Elixir,
Located in the one-two count of Kan and Li.
The *Cantong Qi* says: When gold returns to the original nature,
Only then is it called the Returned Elixir.
This is the Golden Fluid’s return to truth,
The Way of uniting form and spirit in wondrous perfection—
Utterly simple, utterly easy.
Once attained, it is forever attained.
Thus the myriad discourses and thousand scriptures,
Able to transform and naturally generate spirit,
If one obtains their oral transmission,
Even the most foolish and lowly may at once ascend to sagehood.
Therefore the celestial mechanism is guarded in secrecy,
Never to be transmitted to the unworthy.
To lightly divulge or recklessly transmit it
Brings calamity upon nine generations.
Thus know that the Golden Elixir is the supreme, most true path.

When the two substances meet, emotion and nature unite,
When the Five Phases are complete, tiger and dragon coil.
True One Master says: Gold is emotion; water is nature.
Gold is born of water, just as emotion arises from nature;
Water is concealed within gold, just as emotion returns to nature.
Or one may ask: If gold is the mother, how can it be called emotion?
Yet the *Cantong Qi* says: Gold is the mother of water—
The mother is concealed within the child.
When they meet, gold and water merge;
When fully gathered, tiger and dragon coil.
Thus the next chapter says:
Once the two substances are driven into the Yellow Path,
How can the numinous elixir fail to be born?

The *Cantong Qi* says: Kan is water, the moon,
In man, the kidneys.
The kidneys generate essence,
Within which resides the true yang qi,
Flaming upward.
Essence is yin, qi is yang—
Thus lead is soft, silver is hard.
The tiger’s nature belongs to metal,
And metal can generate water.
Inverting the sequence, one takes it—
The mother concealed within the child’s womb,
Thus the tiger is born within water.
The tiger corresponds to lead,
The yang within yin.
Li is fire, the sun,
In man, the heart.
The heart generates blood,
Within which flows the true one’s fluid,
Descending downward.
Blood is yang, fluid is yin—
Thus cinnabar is yang, mercury is yin.
The dragon’s nature belongs to wood,
And wood can generate fire.
Inverting the sequence, one takes it—
The mother concealed within the child’s womb,
Thus the dragon emerges from within fire.
The dragon corresponds to mercury,
The yin within yang.

Originally, they rely on wu and ji as matchmakers,
Thus husband and wife are firmly united in joy.
Ye Shibiao says: Kan and Li receive wu and ji,
The qi of wu and ji within Kan and Li.
This speaks of the two substances, through the central qi’s ascent and descent,
Generating union and harmony.
Master Wuming says: Wu and ji belong to earth—
This is called the Yellow Dame.
Dragon and tiger, metal and wood, are separated by east and west;
The Yellow Dame brings them together—
Is this not matchmaking?

Only await the work’s completion to pay homage at the northern palace,
Within ninefold radiance, riding a propitious simurgh.

Only await the work’s completion to pay homage at the northern pass,
Within ninefold radiance, riding a propitious luan.

IV
This method is true within the true, most wondrous,
All because I alone differ from others.
I know the inversion arises from Li and Kan,
Who recognizes the floating and sinking to determine host and guest?
Ye Shibiao says: The five positions harmonize, their names conjoined.
Qian receives jia and ren, one and nine making ten;
Kun receives yi and gui, four and six making ten;
Gen and Zhen receive bing and geng, three and seven making ten;
Xun and Dui receive xin and ding, two and eight making ten;
Kan and Li receive wu and ji, together making fifteen.
Inverting above and below without change,
Thus all inversions and ascents depend upon them.

chunks.original_text: 沉汞浮，况者为主，浮者为客。 ○袁公辅曰：惟其如此，是以古之真仙上圣皆知阴阳颠倒在坎离两卦，但世罕有识得浮沉主宾者。 故高象先云：举世无人识河车是也。 金鼎欲留朱裹汞，玉池先下水中银。 叶士表日； 此言浮沉主客也。 离火生汞，坎水生金，汞因铅结，铅制汞伏，乃子母相应也。 《参同契》曰：河上媳女灵　　　而最神，得火则飞，不见埃尘，鬼匿龙潜，莫知所存，将欲制之，黄芽为银。 真一子曰：黄芽，铅也，此两句正应得上文颠倒坎离之说。 《大易志图》曰：阴中有阳者，象铅中有阴也。 黄芽产於河车之中。 歌曰：黄芽铅汞造，阴壳含阳华。 篇意谓：铃先驱龙下就虎之气，然复方得二气交合，可以施功锻炼，结成真一之精也。 神功运火非终夕，现出探潭日一轮。 叶士表日； 天地运神功以生万物，人能法天地以运符火，不待旦夕之问，元海阳光生也。 真人谓：一时辰内管丹成，即此义　　　也。 ○无名子曰：火即二弦之气，非终旦者，明一时之中金丹之成也。 此法外药法象也。 五
chunks.translated_text:
The mercury sinks, the lead floats—what sinks serves as host, what floats as guest.

○ Master Yuan Fubo says: Precisely because of this, the ancient perfected immortals and sagely worthies all knew that the inversion of yin and yang lies within the Kan and Li trigrams. Yet few in the world recognize the floating and sinking to determine host and guest. Thus Gao Xiangxian said: *"In all the world, none know the River Chariot."* The golden crucible seeks to retain cinnabar-wrapped mercury; the jade pool first descends with silver in water.

○ Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of the floating and sinking of host and guest. The fire of Li gives birth to mercury; the water of Kan gives birth to metal. Mercury coalesces through lead; lead subdues and tames mercury—this is the resonance of mother and child. The *Cantong Qi* states: *"The maiden by the river is numinous and most divine. When fire is applied, she takes flight, vanishing like dust. Spirits hide, dragons lie concealed—none know where she abides. To restrain her, use the yellow sprout as silver."*

True Yizi says: The yellow sprout is lead. These two lines directly correspond to the earlier discussion of the inversion of Kan and Li. The *Dayi Zhi Tu* states: *"That yin contains yang is like lead containing yin."* The yellow sprout is produced within the River Chariot.

A song says:
*"The yellow sprout, lead, and mercury refine,
Within yin’s husk, yang’s radiance shines."*

The purport of this passage is: One must first drive the dragon to descend and join the tiger’s qi, only then can the two qi intermingle, allowing the work of forging and refinement to proceed, coalescing into the essence of the True One.

Divine workings move the fire not through the whole night—
A single wheel of the sun emerges from the deep pool’s reflection.

○ Ye Shibiao says: Heaven and earth employ divine workings to generate the myriad things. If one can emulate heaven and earth by moving the talismanic fire, then without waiting between dawn and dusk, the yang radiance arises from the primordial sea. The Perfected One said: *"Within a single double-hour, the elixir is complete"*—this is the meaning.

○ The Nameless Master says: The fire is the qi of the two crescents. "Not through the whole night" clarifies that within a single double-hour, the golden elixir is accomplished. This is the method of the external medicine and its symbolic correspondences.

chunks.original_text: 虎跃龙腾风浪赢，中央正位产玄珠。 果生枝上终期熟，子在胞中岂有殊。 叶士表曰：坎离之气如云龙风虎，奔腾飞跃，至中官产元珠也。 珠者金母，所生真汞。 《参同契》温养子珠是也，如生枝上、子在胎中，待其数足也。 袁公辅曰：腾跃浪赢者，言二物难调伏之状，若中官能正其位，故能吸引二物之精，於中官生长真汞，如果生枝上，子育胞中，待其数足而成也。 《资生经》曰：脐下三寸为下丹田，方圆四寸，着脊梁两　肾中问，左青右白，上黄下黑，中央赤，名大海，而贮其血气，亦名大中，极言取人身上下四向，最为中也。 中央正位，即丹　田金胎神室也。 南北宗源翻卦象，晨昏火候合天枢。 果 叶士表曰：坎离上下有既济、未济之象，朝屯暮蒙，一一合天之枢机也。 象川翁曰：子为六阳之首，故为晨，用屯卦，直事，进火之侯也。 午为六阴之首，故为昏，用蒙卦，直事，进水之候也。 一日之问用两卦直事，至三十日终於既济未济二卦，终而复始。 一日两卦直事，连牝牡四卦，一月计六十四卦，一卦六爻，六十四卦计三百八十四爻，一年并闰余之数，皆依斗建而运之，故曰合天枢也。 无名子曰：闰余之数，乾之初九起於坤之初六，乾之策三十有六，六爻计二百一十有六。 坤之初六起於乾之初九，坤之策二十有四，六爻计一百四十有四。 总而计之，三百六十，应周天之度。 日月行速，一月一周天，日行迟，一岁一周天。 天枢者，斗枢也，一昼夜一周天，而一月一移也，如正月建寅，二月建卯是也。 且如正月建寅，立春时指艮，雨水戌时指寅，故曰：月月常加戌，时时见破军。 上古至人，知日月盈亏，明阴阳上下，行子午符火，曰戌有昼夜数月，应时加喊，然后暗合天度，故曰合天枢也。 至道至妙，妙在於斯，坎离升降，生产灵药，结成黄芽。 袁公辅曰：子午为坎离之宗源，循历十二位，翻诸卦爻，朝屯暮蒙，为六十卦符火之首要，一一合天之枢机也。 须知大隐居郦市，何必深山守静孤。 叶士表曰：此言得法与不得法。 得法者，虽居市朝可为也。 袁公辅曰：苟得其法，虽不在深山穷谷，可修持也。 六 人人尽有长生药，自是愚迷枉摆抛。 叶士表日；
chunks.translated_text:
The tiger leaps, the dragon soars—wind and waves surge,
At the central true position, the Mystic Pearl is born.
Though fruit ripens on the branch, its time must come,
How different is the child within the womb?

○ Ye Shibiao says: The qi of Kan and Li are like cloud-dragons and wind-tigers, galloping and soaring. When they reach the Central Palace, the Primordial Pearl is produced. The Pearl is the Metal Mother, which gives birth to true mercury. As the *Cantong Qi* says of "warming and nurturing the child-pearl," it is like fruit growing on the branch or a child maturing in the womb, awaiting the fulfillment of its allotted time.

○ Yuan Gongfu says: The surging waves describe the untamed state of the two substances. Only when the Central Palace holds its true position can it draw in the essence of both, nurturing true mercury within—just as fruit ripens on the branch or a child grows in the womb, awaiting the completion of its term. The *Zisheng Jing* states: "Three inches below the navel lies the Lower Cinnabar Field, four inches square, nestled between the spine and the two kidneys. To the left, blue; to the right, white; above, yellow; below, black; at the center, red. It is called the Great Sea, storing blood and qi, and also the Great Center, for it is the exact midpoint of the body’s four directions. The central true position is the Golden Womb, the spirit-chamber of the Cinnabar Field."

North and South Schools reverse the hexagrams’ images,
Morning and evening fire-phases align with the Celestial Pivot.

○ Ye Shibiao says: Kan and Li, above and below, form the images of *Jiji* and *Weiji*. From dawn’s *Zhun* to dusk’s *Meng*, each corresponds to the pivot of heaven.

○ Xiangchuan Weng says: *Zi* is the head of the six yang, hence the morning, governed by the *Zhun* hexagram—its proper affair is the phase of advancing fire. *Wu* is the head of the six yin, hence the evening, governed by the *Meng* hexagram—its proper affair is the phase of advancing water. Within a single day, two hexagrams govern their affairs; over thirty days, the cycle concludes with the *Jiji* and *Weiji* hexagrams, then begins anew. Each day’s two governing hexagrams, combined with the four hexagrams of *Pin* and *Mou*, total sixty-four hexagrams in a month. Each hexagram has six lines, so sixty-four hexagrams yield three hundred eighty-four lines. Including intercalary months, the yearly count follows the Dipper’s revolution—hence it is said to align with the Celestial Pivot.

○ The Nameless Master says: The intercalary count begins with Qian’s first nine rising from Kun’s first six. Qian’s tally is thirty-six, and its six lines total two hundred sixteen. Kun’s first six rises from Qian’s first nine; Kun’s tally is twenty-four, and its six lines total one hundred forty-four. Combined, they make three hundred sixty, matching the degrees of the celestial sphere. The moon moves swiftly, completing a circuit in a month; the sun moves slowly, completing one in a year. The Celestial Pivot is the Dipper’s pivot, which revolves once in a day and night and shifts once a month—thus, in the first month, it aligns with *yin*; in the second, with *mao*. For example, in the first month, *jianyin* points to *gen* at the start of spring, and to *yin* at the *xu* hour of Rain Water. Hence the saying: *"Month by month it ever adds to xu, hour by hour it meets the Broken Army."* The sages of antiquity, knowing the waxing and waning of sun and moon and the ascent and descent of yin and yang, practiced the *zi-wu* talismanic fire. They said: *"Xu holds the day-and-night count of months; applying it in due season, it secretly accords with celestial degrees."* Thus it is called aligning with the Celestial Pivot. The supreme Dao, the wondrous mystery—its marvel lies here. Kan and Li rise and descend, giving birth to the numinous medicine, congealing the Yellow Sprout.

○ Yuan Gongfu says: *Zi* and *wu* are the ancestral sources of Kan and Li. Traversing the twelve positions and inverting the hexagrams’ lines, from dawn’s *Zhun* to dusk’s *Meng*, they form the essentials of the sixty hexagrams’ talismanic fire, each aligning with the pivot of heaven.

One need not dwell in deep mountains to guard solitary stillness—
The great hermit may abide even in the marketplace.

○ Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of those who have attained the method and those who have not. For those who have, even living amid the marketplace is possible.

○ Yuan Gongfu says: If one has grasped the method, cultivation is possible even without retreating to remote mountains and valleys.

Every person possesses the medicine of long life,
Yet fools, deluded, cast it heedlessly away.

○ Ye Shibiao says:

chunks.original_text: 人之初生，均受一点元阳之气，为养命之本，男子自二八而真精泄，女子自二七而天癸降，然后有夫妻之欲。 众　　生迷蒙，醉於情爱，日夜漏泄，不知其几何也。 本去根桔，之死爻矣。 世人但知养生止於禁欲，殊不知一念若动，气随心散，精逐气亡。 为此道者当心体大虚，内外如一，然后可以论金液大还丹之道也。 甘露降时天地合，黄芽生处坎离交。 叶士表曰； 天地相合以降甘露，人身抱冲和之气与天地等，若能离形去智，淡然无欲，则真气流行，上彻天谷，如甘露降矣。 坎离升降，生产灵汞，结成黄芽。 袁公辅曰：天地相合以降甘露，坎离相交以生黄芽，真人以四者取譬，尽乾坤坎离也。 井蛙应谓无龙窟，篱鸥争知有凤巢。 叶士表曰：此喻无知小人所见卑浅，不信大丹有换骨回阳、超凡入圣乐於勺水，篱鸥居於寸地，不知大海有龙官之富，邓林　　有凤巢之广也。 袁公辅曰：盖世之愚迷之徒，不至死坏而不悔，如井蛙不知有大海，篱鸥不知有邓林也。 丹熟自然金满屋，何须寻草学烧茅。 叶士表曰：金丹大药，本天地虚无自然之气，从无质而生。 丹熟则体变金玉，发现神光，巍巍堂堂。 证真金相，岂同世俗寻草探药、易铜铁之质哉？ 袁公辅曰：药成之后，金光透体，奚用寻草烧茅，以事假伪邪？ 七 要知产药川源处，只在西南是本乡。 叶士表曰：此言运符产药也。 西南，坤地，乃太阴本乡。 月三日生魄於西南，故丹药自坤而产也。 铅遇癸生须急采，金逢望远不堪尝。 叶士表曰：癸亦坤，坤纳癸，言药本太阴之气，随月初生便当探也，十五以后，月亏气喊，不宜探矣。 太阴，即太阳炁也。 月本无光，因日生明，一阳为震，月初生也，二阳为兑，月上弦也，三阳为乾，月盈满也。 袁公辅曰：自月初生为一阳，起震卦，至十五为三阳，属乾卦，阳极阴生，故十五已后，月亏气喊，以应三阴，秋冬肃杀之气，不宜探也。 苟於十已后探之，是为孤阴。 《易传》云：独阴不生，独阳不成。 象川翁曰：铅遇癸生须急探，金逢望远不堪尝，言铅与金，即金丹也。 以癸日子时用功急探，不得逾时也。 叶文叔以为坤纳癸，误矣，一本作癸日子时者，是矣。 盖癸日遁得壬子时，天壬地癸会于北方，故朱震《易传》曰：晦日朔旦，坎月离日，会于壬癸。 坎月，戊也； 离日，己也。 又曰：三日暮震象，月出庚。 八日兑象，月见丁。 十五日乾象，月盈甲壬。 十六日旦，巽象，月退辛。 二十三日艮象，月消丙。 三十日坤象，月喊乙藏癸。 晦日朔旦坎水流，戊日中离火就己。 无名子曰：铅遇癸生，癸生者，时将丑也。 金逢望远，望远者，月将亏也。 月之圆，存乎口诀：时之子妙在心传，周天息数微微数，玉漏寒声滴滴符。 此真人口口相传之密旨也。 五
chunks.translated_text:
At the moment of birth, every person receives a single point of primordial yang qi, which is the root of life-sustenance. In men, from the age of sixteen (二八), true essence begins to discharge; in women, from the age of fourteen (二七), *tian gui* descends, and thereafter the desire between husband and wife arises. Yet the multitude of beings, lost in delusion, intoxicated by love and passion, leak and dissipate day and night, unaware of how much they lose. The root thus withers, and the line of death is drawn.

The world knows only that nurturing life requires abstaining from desire, yet fails to realize that with the stirring of a single thought, qi scatters with the heart, and essence perishes with qi. Those who pursue this Dao must embody the great void, making inner and outer as one—only then can the discourse on the Great Return Elixir of Golden Liquor begin.

When sweet dew descends, heaven and earth unite;
Where yellow sprouts arise, Kan and Li converge.

○ Ye Shibiao says: When heaven and earth unite, sweet dew descends. The human body, embracing the harmonious qi, becomes equal to heaven and earth. If one can detach from form and abandon cunning, becoming serene and desireless, true qi will flow freely, ascending to the Celestial Valley like descending sweet dew. Kan and Li rise and fall, giving birth to numinous mercury, which coalesces into the yellow sprout.

○ Yuan Gongfu says: Heaven and earth unite to send down sweet dew; Kan and Li converge to produce the yellow sprout. The true person draws parallels from these four, encompassing Qian, Kun, Kan, and Li. *"The well-frog may claim no dragon’s lair exists; the hedge-gull may dispute the phoenix’s nest."* Those of shallow vision, like the well-frog, deny the existence of the vast ocean’s dragon palace; like the hedge-gull, they know not the boundless phoenix nest in Deng Forest.

○ Ye Shibiao says: This metaphor illustrates how petty and ignorant people, with their limited vision, disbelieve in the great elixir’s power to transform bones, reverse yang, and transcend the mundane to enter sagehood—delighting in a mere spoonful of water, dwelling in a patch of land, unaware of the dragon palace’s riches in the great sea or the phoenix’s vast nest in Deng Forest.

○ Yuan Gongfu says: The foolish and deluded of the world persist in their ways until death without repentance, like the well-frog unaware of the ocean or the hedge-gull ignorant of Deng Forest.

When the elixir ripens, gold naturally fills the house—
Why seek herbs or burn thatch in vain?

○ Ye Shibiao says: The great medicine of the golden elixir is the qi of heaven and earth’s natural emptiness, born from the formless. When the elixir matures, the body transforms into gold and jade, radiating divine light, majestic and resplendent. How can this compare to the worldly pursuit of herbs and minerals, merely altering copper and iron?

○ Yuan Gongfu says: Once the medicine is complete, golden light permeates the body—why bother seeking herbs or burning thatch to engage in false and deceptive practices?

To know the source where the medicine is produced,
Look only to the southwest as its native land.

○ Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of circulating the talisman to produce the medicine. The southwest is the earth of Kun, the native land of Great Yin. On the third day of the lunar month, the waning moon appears in the southwest, hence the elixir is born from Kun.

When lead meets *gui*, gather it swiftly;
When gold reaches its fullest, it is no longer fit to taste.

○ Ye Shibiao says: *Gui* is also Kun; Kun receives *gui*. This means the medicine is the qi of Great Yin, and one should gather it as soon as the moon begins to wax. After the fifteenth day, the moon wanes and qi declines, making it unsuitable for gathering. Great Yin is the qi of Great Yang. The moon itself has no light but shines by the sun’s reflection. One yang is Zhen (the moon’s first crescent); two yang is Dui (the first quarter); three yang is Qian (the full moon).

○ Yuan Gongfu says: From the moon’s first appearance as one yang (Zhen), to the fifteenth day as three yang (Qian), yang reaches its peak and yin begins to grow. Thus, after the fifteenth, the moon wanes and qi declines, corresponding to the three yin and the withering qi of autumn and winter—unsuitable for gathering. To gather after the tenth day is to isolate yin. The *Yi Zhuan* states: *"Solitary yin does not generate; solitary yang does not complete."*

○ Xiangchuan Weng says: *"When lead meets gui, gather it swiftly; when gold reaches its fullest, it is no longer fit to taste."* Lead and gold here refer to the golden elixir. One must act swiftly at the *gui* day’s *zi* hour, not delaying beyond the moment. Ye Wenshu mistakenly took *gui* as Kun; an alternate version reads *"gui day, zi hour,"* which is correct. For on the *gui* day, the cyclical sign *ren-zi* is obtained, where heavenly *ren* and earthly *gui* meet in the north. As Zhu Zhen’s *Yi Zhuan* states: *"At the dark of the moon’s dawn, Kan’s moon and Li’s sun meet at ren-gui."* Kan’s moon is *wu*; Li’s sun is *ji*. It also says: *"On the third day’s dusk, the moon appears in the east (Zhen); on the eighth day, it appears in the west (Dui); on the fifteenth day, it is full (Qian), appearing at jia-ren. On the sixteenth day’s dawn, it wanes (Xun), appearing at xin. On the twenty-third day, it wanes further (Gen), appearing at bing. On the thirtieth day, it is dark (Kun), appearing at yi, with gui concealed."* At the dark of the moon’s dawn, Kan’s water flows; at *wu* noon, Li’s fire aligns with *ji*.

○ Wumingzi says: *"When lead meets gui, gui* refers to the approach of the *chou* hour. *When gold reaches its fullest* means the moon is about to wane. The moon’s fullness depends on oral transmission; the subtlety of the *zi* hour lies in heart-to-heart transmission. The breath of the celestial cycle counts silently; the cold drips of the jade clepsydra mark the rhythm."* This is the secret essence passed down from mouth to mouth.

chunks.original_text: 送归土釜牢封闭， 叶士表曰：此言一日所得之药。 土釜，中官也，封闭使真熙不泄耳。 《参同契》曰：三者既关键，缓体处空房，委归虚无，无念以为常。 袁公辅曰：修神丹者，能顺则天地神机妙用，取而法之，不差於时，不失於偏，又能闭塞中官，不致渗漏，始能与真汞相匹偶也。 次入流珠厮配当。 叶士表曰：此言次日再运流珠入鼎，与昨日所结之药合和也。 无名子曰：既得黍珠之后，饵丹归丹田土釜中，固济胞胎不泄，运火飞珠之汞以配之，则灵胎始结矣。 药重一斤须二八，调停火候托阴阳。 叶士表曰：此言一鼎之火。 几一鼎火计三十日三百六十时，以应易数。 盖易有六十四卦，计三百八十四爻。 乾坤坎离四卦，为鼎器、药物言之也。 若时日有亏，爻符不足，则药不成矣。 《参同契》曰：火记不虚作，演易以明之。 偃月法炉鼎，白虎为熬枢。 汞日为流珠，青龙与之俱。 举束以合西，魂魄自相拘。 上弦兑数八，下弦数亦八，两弦合其精，乾坤体乃成。 二八应一斤，易道正不倾。 铢有三百八十四，以应火候爻之数。 袁公辅曰：药须二八方成，上下两弦合一斤之数。 故得金虎木龙之精，化为真丹。 人非阴阳两备，道不可成，又非得火候调和烹炼，终不成大丹也。 真人切於付嘱云。 象川翁曰：乌肝八两，兔髓半斤，合成一斤，故日须二八也。 《大易志图》曰：凡用火，五日一候，一月六候，十二月七十二侯，以终一年之功。 一日有十二时，三十日有三百六十时，每日合一月用火，象一年小周天，十二月象十二年，大周天而毕矣。 八 休炼三黄及四神，若寻众药便非真。 叶士表曰：混沌未判，中具两仪，两仪则五行生成之数也。 有性无形，及乎太极既分，则甲己之熙化真土，乙庚之黑化真金，丙辛之无化真水，丁壬之熙化真木，戊癸之炁化真火。 此五者，散而为物类也。 大丹之法，无质生质，亦若此矣。 为此道者，知先天一炁之祖，体虚无自然之数，则造化不难，奚假众药。 《参同契》曰：近在我形，不离己身，抱一毋拾，可以长存，配以服食，雌雄设陈，挺除武都，八石弃捐。 阴阳得类归交感， 二八相当自合亲。 《参同契》曰：类同者相从事，乖不成宝。 二八，金木也，金木相交则为夫妻，所谓金伐木荣是也。 袁公辅曰：阴阳得类，盖归之交感而然，正如金木二八相交而成，上下两弦自合亲者，盖不期然而然矣。 潭底日红阴怪灭，山头月白药苗新。 时人要识真铅汞，不是凡砂及水银。 叶士表曰：几药，归中官凝结者，为阳，在外生产者，为阴。 譬如月因日而有亏而日光元不动也。 袁公辅曰：潭底日红阴怪灭者，谓太阴极於坤位，再得太阳交合，则山头徒现黄芽也。 此真铅真汞，非凡砂水银之比。 九 莫把孤阴为有阳，独修一物转羸廷。 叶士表曰：此言习性砷於顽空，不知造化者，固多枯坐，气血修涩，转见赢旭矣。 锺离先生曰：无心兀兀坐多年，将谓神仙已有缘，不解龙吟并虎啸，谓之枯坐又徒然。 又曰：有无交入名丹本，隐显相符是水金，莫谓此身俱是道，独修一物是孤阴。 象川翁曰：场裹阴精者，己之真精是也。 精为生气，气能生神，荣卫一身，莫大於此。 故古人戒之曰：油枯灯　　灭，髓竭人亡。

Send it back to the earthen crucible, sealing it tightly.
Ye Shibiao says: "This speaks of the medicine obtained in a single day. The earthen crucible is the Central Palace; sealing it ensures the true *xi* does not leak."
The *Cantong Qi* states: "When the three are interlocked, rest the body in an empty chamber, entrusting it to emptiness and non-thought as the constant. Let it return to the formless."

Yuan Gongfu says: "Those who refine the divine elixir must align with the celestial mechanism’s marvelous workings, emulate it without error in timing, avoid imbalance, and seal the Central Palace to prevent leakage. Only then can it pair with true mercury."
Next, introduce the flowing pearl to unite in harmony.
Ye Shibiao says: "This speaks of the following day, when the flowing pearl is again circulated into the tripod to merge with the medicine formed the previous day."
Wumingzi says: "After obtaining the millet pearl, ingest the elixir into the earthen crucible of the Cinnabar Field, securing the womb to prevent leakage. Circulate the fire to fly the pearl-like mercury and pair it—only then does the numinous embryo begin to form."

The medicine weighs one *jin*, requiring two eights;
adjust the fire’s timing to entrust it to yin and yang.
Ye Shibiao says: "This speaks of the fire in one tripod. A single tripod’s fire spans thirty days and three hundred sixty hours, corresponding to the *Yi*’s numbers. The *Yi* has sixty-four hexagrams totaling three hundred eighty-four lines. Qian, Kun, Kan, and Li represent the tripod and medicinal substances. If the days or hours are deficient, or the lines incomplete, the medicine will not form."
The *Cantong Qi* states: "The fire record is not made in vain; the *Yi* is expounded to clarify it. The crescent moon models the furnace; the White Tiger is the pivot of refinement. Mercury, the sun’s flowing pearl, accompanies the Azure Dragon. Raise the east to meet the west, and the hun and po naturally bind. The upper crescent’s number is eight; the lower crescent’s number is also eight. When the two crescents merge their essence, the Qian and Kun bodies are complete. Two eights correspond to one *jin*—the *Yi*’s Dao remains upright. Each *zhu* has three hundred eighty-four, matching the fire’s timing and the lines’ count."
Yuan Gongfu says: "The medicine requires two eights to form, the upper and lower crescents combining into one *jin*. Thus, the essence of the Metal Tiger and Wood Dragon transforms into true cinnabar. Without both yin and yang, the Dao cannot be achieved; without proper fire timing and refinement, the Great Elixir will never form."
The Perfected One urgently entrusted this warning.

Xiangchuan Weng says: "Eight ounces of crow’s liver, half a *jin* of hare’s marrow—combined, they make one *jin*, hence the need for two eights."
The *Dayi Zhi Tu* states: "In using fire, five days make one phase; one month has six phases; twelve months have seventy-two phases, completing a year’s work. One day has twelve hours; thirty days have three hundred sixty hours. Each day’s fire corresponds to a month’s use, modeling a year’s minor celestial cycle. Twelve months model twelve years, completing the great celestial cycle."

Do not refine the Three Yellows or Four Spirits;
seeking myriad medicines is not the true path.
Ye Shibiao says: "Before the primordial chaos divided, the Two Modes were already present—the Two Modes being the generative numbers of the Five Phases. Without form yet possessing nature, once the Great Ultimate separated, *jia* and *ji*’s *xi* transformed into true earth; *yi* and *geng*’s blackness into true metal; *bing* and *xin*’s nothingness into true water; *ding* and *ren*’s *xi* into true wood; *wu* and *gui*’s *qi* into true fire. These five scatter into the myriad things. The Great Elixir’s method—form arising from the formless—follows this principle. Those who pursue this Dao, knowing the primordial unity of the One *Qi*’s origin and embodying the natural numbers of emptiness, will find creation effortless—why seek myriad medicines?"
The *Cantong Qi* states: "It is near in my form, not apart from this body. Embrace the One and do not lose it—you may long endure. Pair it with ingestion; arrange the feminine and masculine. Discard the martial cinnabar of Wudu; cast away the eight stones."
Yin and yang of the same kind return to mutual resonance;
two eights correspond and naturally unite.
The *Cantong Qi* states: "Like kinds follow one another; discord cannot form treasure. Two eights—metal and wood—when joined become husband and wife, as in ‘metal fells wood to flourish.’"
Yuan Gongfu says: "Yin and yang of the same kind return to mutual resonance. Just as metal and wood’s two eights unite to form, the upper and lower crescents naturally unite—unexpected yet inevitable."

At the pool’s depths, the sun glows red and yin’s monstrosities vanish;
at the mountain’s peak, the moon shines white and the medicine’s sprouts renew.
People of this age must recognize true lead and mercury—
they are not common cinnabar or quicksilver.
Ye Shibiao says: "The medicine that returns to the Central Palace to congeal is yang; that which is produced externally is yin. Like the moon, which waxes and wanes due to the sun, the sun’s light remains fundamentally unmoved."
Yuan Gongfu says: "‘At the pool’s depths, the sun glows red and yin’s monstrosities vanish’ means that when Supreme Yin reaches the Kun position, uniting again with Supreme Yang, the mountain’s peak reveals the Yellow Sprout. This is true lead and true mercury—not comparable to common cinnabar or quicksilver."

Do not take solitary yin for yang;
cultivating a single thing only leads to emaciation.
Ye Shibiao says: "This speaks of those who cling to stubborn emptiness, ignorant of creation’s workings. Many sit in desiccation, their qi and blood withering, becoming increasingly frail."
Master Zhongli says: "Sitting motionless for years, thinking oneself near the immortals’ fate—yet without understanding the dragon’s roar or tiger’s howl, it is mere desiccation, futile."
He also says: "The intermingling of being and non-being is the elixir’s root; the correspondence of concealment and revelation is water and metal. Do not claim this body is entirely the Dao—cultivating a single thing is solitary yin."
Xiangchuan Weng says: "The yin essence in the field is one’s true essence. Essence generates qi; qi generates spirit. Nothing nourishes the body more than these."
Thus, the ancients warned: "When the oil is exhausted, the lamp goes out; when the marrow is depleted, the person perishes."

chunks.original_text: 此言精气实一身之根本也。 奈何此物属阴，其质不刚，其性好飞，不受制炼，若不得混元真一之阳以制之，则无由凝结以成变化。 锺离先生曰：涕唾精津气血液，七般物事总为阴。 若将此物为丹质，怎得飞神贡石金。 劳形按引皆非道，炼气飧霞总是狂。 毕世馒求铅汞伏，何时得见虎龙降。 《大易志图》曰：夫修金丹，言刑杀者是也，更相制伏也，若无制伏，则神气不交。 故李荃云：金丹之卫百数，其要在神水华池，是阴一而制阳一之道，华池之义也。 《参同契》曰：白者金精　是阳一，黑者水基是阴一。 水者，道枢，其数名一，是为三。 一，金丹是也。 ○无名子曰：但将白虎擒龙，自有青龙制虎，二熙相吞而产金丹。 既得此丹，复将此也。 内之真龙真虎既降，则世外龙虎自伏。 内炼神魂鬼魄既圣，则世外鬼神自钦。 非道隆德助，孰能与於此哉？ 劝君穷取生身处，返本还元是药王。 叶士表曰人受生之初，在胞胎之内，随母呼吸，受气而成。 及乎有生，剪去脐蒂，一点元灵之气聚於脐下，日复一日，神出气离，离其本源驱驰外务，不知返本还元之道，圣人指性命之根，令人收神聚气，还返往来，归根复命也。 袁公辅曰：世人妄认父母精血为本来面目，生身之处，非也。 殊不知人禀先天一炁而生，须认母之母，识真铅之祖宗可矣。 且如稻遇六月，至午时开花，其中有精，如一点水，便是戊己，一感真阳之熙，随即结秀，百日成熟。 所以世人日食无厌者，盖稼穑作甘，洪范为土，能资培一身。 不酸，不辛，不苦，不咸，甜淡其味，加之日飧茗一熙也。 既集欲散，故男子自二八而真精泄，女子自二七而天癸降，然后有夫妻之欲，一有感合，则结成胎孕。 子在胞中，随母呼吸，受气而成十月数周，胎完气足，灵光入体，脱出其胞。 及乎剪去脐蒂，一点元灵之气聚於脐下，日复一日，神出气移，亏散真源，离其本根，终致死坏耳。 真人愍夫世人流浪生死，沉溺爱河，作为歌诗，直指性命之根，以勉世人，其意若曰：始因父母二气，无质生质，既长养成为乎？ 今也既解生身之处矣，欲要不可。 象川翁曰：真龙真虎者，二八是也。 真铅真汞者，二弦气是也。 但学者多以旁门小径、非类之物为铅汞，故仙翁直指所产之处，返此之本，还此之元，为药王也。 十 好把真铅着意寻，莫教容易度光阴。 叶士表曰：铅者，，北方正熙，一点初生之真阳，为药母也。 太上曰：以铅为君，以汞为臣，铅若不真，汞亦难亲。 故铅为造化之主。 但将地魄擒朱汞，自有天魂制水金。 袁公辅曰：欲得真铅，但将地魄擒朱汞，阴求阳也，便见天魂制水金也，乃阳求阴也。 可谓道高龙虎伏，堪言德重鬼神钦。 已知永寿齐天地，烦恼无由更上心。 叶士表曰：龙虎，即铅汞也。 鬼神，魂魄也。 十一 黄芽白雪不难寻，达者须凭德行深。 四象五行全藉土，三元八卦岂离壬。 叶士表曰：四象，青龙、白虎、朱雀，玄武也。 五行，金木水火土也。 因一坎离戊己而造化。 三元，支干纳音也。 八卦，乾坤坎离艮震巽兑也。 皆不离混沌之中。 壬者，妊也，天壬地癸会于北方，故万物妊娠於子。 袁公辅曰：四象，龙虎雀武也，五行，金木水火土也，皆非戊己真土，不能钻簇而成丹基。
chunks.translated_text:
This speaks of essence and qi as the very root of the body.

Yet this substance belongs to yin—its nature is not firm, its temperament prone to flight. If not restrained and refined, it cannot be coagulated to undergo transformation. Without the primal yang of the Undifferentiated Unity to govern it, there is no way for it to congeal and achieve transmutation.

Master Zhongli says:
Tears, saliva, essence, fluids, qi, and blood—
these seven things are all yin.
If one takes these as the substance of the elixir,
how can the spirit ascend to offer cinnabar and gold?
Exerting the body through pressing and guiding is not the Dao;
refining qi and consuming auroral mist is mere delusion.
Though one may spend a lifetime seeking the subjugation of lead and mercury,
when will one ever witness the descent of tiger and dragon?

*The Great Yi’s Aspiration Diagram* says: In cultivating the golden elixir, what is meant by "punishment and execution" is mutual restraint. Without restraint, spirit and qi do not intermingle.

Thus Li Quan states: Among the hundreds of methods guarding the golden elixir, the essential lies in the divine water of the Flowery Pond. This is the Dao of one yin governing one yang—the meaning of the Flowery Pond.

*The Kinship of the Three* says:
White is the essence of metal—this is yang-one;
black is the foundation of water—this is yin-one.
Water is the pivot of the Dao, its number named one—thus it is three.
One is the golden elixir.

The Nameless Master says:
Simply capture the White Tiger to seize the Dragon,
and naturally the Azure Dragon will restrain the Tiger.
The two breaths devour one another, giving birth to the golden elixir.
Having attained this elixir, apply it thus:
Once the true Dragon and true Tiger within are subdued,
the dragons and tigers beyond the world will submit of themselves.
Once the inner refining of spirit, soul, ghost, and vitality is perfected,
the ghosts and spirits beyond the world will revere you.
Without the flourishing of the Dao and the aid of virtue, who could achieve this?

I urge you to exhaustively seek the place of your birth—
returning to the root and restoring the origin is the King of Medicines.

Ye Shibiao says: At the beginning of human life, within the womb, one follows the mother’s breath, receiving qi to take form. Upon birth, the umbilical cord is cut, and a single point of primal numinous qi gathers below the navel. Day by day, the spirit departs and qi scatters, drifting from its source to pursue external affairs, unaware of the Dao of returning to the root and restoring the origin. The sages point to the root of nature and life, teaching people to gather spirit and collect qi, to return the coming and going, to revert to the root and restore the mandate.

Yuan Gongfu says: The world mistakenly takes the parents’ essence and blood as the original face, the place of birth—this is not so. One must know that humans are born from the prenatal qi, and one must recognize the mother of the mother, the ancestor of true lead.

Consider rice: when it meets the sixth month and blooms at noon, within its flower lies an essence like a drop of water—this is wu-ji. Upon encountering the true yang’s breath, it immediately forms grain, ripening in a hundred days. Thus, people’s insatiable daily consumption arises because agriculture produces sweetness, the *Hong Fan* ascribes to earth, which can nourish the entire body. Neither sour nor pungent, neither bitter nor salty, its flavor is sweet and mild—augmented by daily tea and the breath of dawn.

Once gathered, it scatters. Thus, men from sixteen onward leak true essence, and women from fourteen onward descend with heavenly water. Thereafter arises the desire between husband and wife. With a single union, conception occurs. The child in the womb follows the mother’s breath, receiving qi to complete the ten-month cycle. When the fetus is complete and qi is full, the numinous light enters the body, and it emerges from the womb. Upon cutting the umbilical cord, a single point of primal numinous qi gathers below the navel. Day by day, the spirit departs and qi shifts, depleting the true source, drifting from the root—ultimately leading to death and decay.

The Perfected One, pitying those who drift in the currents of life and death, drowning in the river of love, composed songs and poems to directly point to the root of nature and life, exhorting the world. His intent was this: Initially, from the two qi of father and mother, formless matter took form. Having grown and been nurtured, what has become of it? Now that you understand the place of your birth, how can you not seek it?

Xiangchuan Weng says: The true Dragon and true Tiger are the two eights. True lead and true mercury are the qi of the two crescents. Yet many learners take side paths and heterodox substances as lead and mercury. Thus, the Immortal Elder directly points to the place of their production, returning to this root, restoring this origin—this is the King of Medicines.

**Ten**
Diligently seek true lead with all your intent,
lest time slip by in vain.
Ye Shibiao says: Lead is the true breath of the north, the first yang newly born—it is the mother of medicine.

The Most High says: Take lead as the lord, mercury as the minister. If the lead is not true, mercury will not draw near. Thus, lead is the master of creation.

Simply capture the Earthly Corpse to seize Vermilion Mercury,
and naturally the Heavenly Soul will restrain Water-Metal.

Yuan Gongfu says: To obtain true lead, capture the Earthly Corpse to seize Vermilion Mercury—this is yin seeking yang. Then you will see the Heavenly Soul restrain Water-Metal—this is yang seeking yin. Truly, when the Dao is lofty, dragons and tigers submit; when virtue is weighty, ghosts and spirits revere.

Having known eternal life equal to heaven and earth,
worries will no longer arise in the heart.

Ye Shibiao says: Dragon and Tiger are lead and mercury. Ghosts and spirits are the soul and vitality.

**Eleven**
Yellow Sprout and White Snow are not hard to find—
the discerning must rely on deep virtue and conduct.
The Four Images and Five Phases all depend on earth;
the Three Origins and Eight Trigrams how could they leave ren?

Ye Shibiao says: The Four Images are the Azure Dragon, White Tiger, Vermilion Bird, and Dark Warrior. The Five Phases are metal, wood, water, fire, and earth. They are transformed through one kan and li, wu and ji. The Three Origins are the stems, branches, and musical notes. The Eight Trigrams are qian, kun, kan, li, gen, zhen, xun, and dui—none depart from the primordial chaos.

Ren means pregnancy. Heavenly ren and earthly gui meet in the north, thus all things conceive in the zi hour.

Yuan Gongfu says: The Four Images are Dragon, Tiger, Bird, and Warrior. The Five Phases are metal, wood, water, fire, and earth. Without true earth of wu-ji, they cannot be drilled and clustered to form the foundation of the elixir.

chunks.original_text: 三元，天地人也，八卦，乾坤坎离艮震巽兑也。 皆自水数一中生出，故不离於混沌之中。 壬者，妊也，天壬地癸会于北方，万物妊娠於子，故金丹亦自混沌中生也。 无名子曰：壬者，水也，真一之水，即真一之精界，天地之母，阴阳之根，水火之本，日月之宗，万物之祖也。 炼成灵质人难识，消尽阴魔鬼莫侵。 欲向人问留秘诀，未闻一个是知音。 叶士表曰：非立谈之事。 十二 草木阴阳亦两齐，若还缺一不芳菲。 初开绿叶阳先唱，次发红花阴后随。 叶士表曰：万物负阴而抱阳，缺一不可，阳先阴后，如铅生汞也。 ○袁公辅日:万物负阴而抱阳，虽草木亦然，缺一不可。 也，却是阳先唱； 次发红花乃阳也，却是阴阳后随。 常道只斯为日用，真源返覆有谁知。 报言学道诸君子，不识阴阳莫强嗤。 袁公辅曰：道之常，每在日用之问，而真源返覆之理，孰有知之者，真人谓学道之人不识阴阳相互代谢，徒嗤鄙也。 十三 不识玄中颠倒颠，争知火裹好栽莲。
chunks.translated_text:
The Three Origins are Heaven, Earth, and Humanity; the Eight Trigrams are qian, kun, kan, li, gen, zhen, xun, and dui. All emerge from the water-number one, thus none depart from the midst of primordial chaos. Ren means pregnancy: heavenly ren and earthly gui meet in the north, and all things conceive in the zi hour. Therefore, the Golden Elixir also arises from within primordial chaos.

Master Wumingzi says: Ren is water, the true One’s water—this is the realm of the true One’s essence, the mother of Heaven and Earth, the root of yin and yang, the origin of water and fire, the ancestor of sun and moon, and the progenitor of the ten thousand things. Refined into a numinous substance, none can recognize it; when yin demons are dissolved, no ghosts may invade. Should one seek to ask others for the secret formula, not a single soul would prove a true confidant.

Ye Shibiao says: This is no matter for casual discussion.

Twelve
Even in grasses and trees, yin and yang stand paired as one;
if either is lacking, no fragrance will bloom.
First unfurl green leaves, yang takes the lead;
next blossom red flowers, yin follows behind.

Ye Shibiao says: All things bear yin yet embrace yang—neither may be absent. Yang precedes, yin follows, just as lead gives rise to mercury.

Yuan Gongfu says: All things bear yin yet embrace yang, and even grasses and trees are no exception—neither may be absent. The first unfolding of green leaves is yang taking the lead; the subsequent blooming of red flowers is yang, yet yin follows behind. The common Dao lies solely in daily practice, but who knows the turning and returning of the true source? I say to all gentlemen who study the Dao: if you do not comprehend yin and yang, do not rashly mock.

Yuan Gongfu says: The constancy of the Dao resides in daily use, yet who understands the principle of the true source’s turning and returning? The Perfected One states that those who study the Dao, failing to recognize the mutual transformation of yin and yang, merely scoff in vain.

Thirteen
If you do not recognize the inversion within the mysterious,
how can you know the lotus cultivated in fire?

chunks.original_text: 《参同契》曰：金入猛火，色不夺光。 日受月化，体不相伤。 此言火裹栽莲，乃阴归阳室也。 无名子曰：日离属阳反是女，月坎属阴反是男。 此类倒也，此二物颠倒而生，却以此丹点己之汞而结圣胎，是谓男儿有孕，犹火中栽莲也。 故仙翁《读参同契》曰：五行逆兮丹体常灵常存，言水逆而土，土逆而木，木逆而金，金逆而火，火逆而水，此类倒颠之义也。 牵将白虎归家养，产个明珠似月圆。 叶士表曰：白虎金精也，探归炉鼎之中，温养成丹，阴化纯阳也。 无名子曰：修丹之法，先取上弦西畔半轮月 ，得阳金八两，次取下弦东轮月 ，合气而生丹，故得金丹一粒似月圆也，两个八两，合成一斤，此仙翁言月圆之意，比喻外丹法象也。 及得此丹吞入己腹中，则金丹却为白虎矣。 又牵此白虎归己腹中养配戊己土，然后运阴符阳火，循历六十四卦，炼成金液还丹一粒，亦重一斤、似月圆矣。 此比喻内药法象也。 内药所以似月圆者，盖运火之卦，一卦有六爻，六十四卦计三百八十四爻，象一斤重三百八十四铢也。 故真一子曰：上下两弦一斤之数，分三百八十四铢，以应火候，爻之计也。 仙翁指祖月圆之意，但欲学者同明造化之旨，分内外二八之数，不可一揆而论也。 馒守药炉看火候， 叶士表曰：世人三年九载锻炼金石，觊欲点化，此谩守也。 但看神息任天然。 叶士表曰：天地有自然之熙，熙有自然之数，人禀天地而生，气数与天地等。 修真之士，穷造化之原，知升降之路，但安神定息，一念不生，湛然无欲，则神熙周流，自然造化。 老子曰：绵绵若存，用之不勤。 群阴剥尽丹成熟，跳出凡笼寿万年。 叶士表曰：真一之熙，阳之郭也，人食五谷窒塞之，不能周流造化，所以一身俱属阴也。 圣人能忘形养熙，忘熙养神，忘神养虚，使坎离消长於一身，风云发泄於七窍，真熙流行，生产丹药，换骨回阳，与天地同久也。 十四 三五一都三个字，古今明者实然稀。
chunks.translated_text:
*The Cantong Qi* states: When gold enters fierce fire, its color does not lose its luster. The sun receives the moon’s transformation, yet their bodies do not harm each other. This speaks of cultivating the lotus in fire—yin returning to the yang chamber.

Master Wuming says: The sun’s *li* belongs to yang yet is the female; the moon’s *kan* belongs to yin yet is the male. This is inversion. These two things are born through inversion, yet with this elixir one refines one’s own mercury to conceive the sacred embryo—this is called "the man becomes pregnant," just as cultivating the lotus in fire. Thus, the Immortal Elder says in *Reading the Cantong Qi*: "The Five Phases reverse, and the elixir’s body remains ever numinous and enduring." Water reverses into earth, earth into wood, wood into metal, metal into fire, fire into water—this is the meaning of inversion.

"Drawing the White Tiger home to nurture,
it gives birth to a luminous pearl like the full moon."

Ye Shibiao says: The White Tiger is the essence of metal. When drawn into the crucible and furnace, warmed and nurtured into the elixir, yin transforms into pure yang. Master Wuming says: The method of refining the elixir first takes the half-moon on the western side at the waxing crescent, obtaining eight ounces of yang metal. Then it takes the half-moon on the eastern side at the waning crescent, combining their qi to generate the elixir. Thus, one obtains a single grain of golden elixir like the full moon. Two eights make a catty—this is the Immortal Elder’s meaning in speaking of the full moon, an analogy for the outer elixir’s symbolic form.

When this elixir is swallowed into one’s belly, the golden elixir becomes the White Tiger. Again, one draws this White Tiger into one’s belly to nurture and pair it with the *wu-ji* earth. Then, circulating the yin tally and yang fire through the sixty-four hexagrams, one refines it into a single grain of golden liquid return-elixir, also weighing one catty and resembling the full moon. This is an analogy for the inner medicine’s symbolic form.

The reason the inner medicine resembles the full moon is that the hexagrams used to circulate fire each have six lines, and sixty-four hexagrams total three hundred eighty-four lines, symbolizing one catty weighing three hundred eighty-four *zhu*. Thus, Master Zhenyi says: "The two crescents’ weight of one catty divides into three hundred eighty-four *zhu*, corresponding to the fire phases and the count of lines."

The Immortal Elder’s reference to the ancestral full moon merely aims for students to together illuminate the intent of creation and destiny, distinguishing the inner and outer eights’ numbers—they cannot be discussed in the same way.

"Guard the medicine furnace and watch the fire phases,"
Ye Shibiao says: People who forge metals and stones for three to nine years, hoping to transmute them, merely guard in vain.
"Yet observe the spirit-breath, letting nature take its course."
Ye Shibiao says: Heaven and earth have their natural harmony; harmony has its natural numbers. Humans, born of heaven and earth, share qi and numbers equal to them. Those who cultivate the truth exhaust the origin of creation and destiny, knowing the paths of ascent and descent. Simply settle the spirit and stabilize the breath, not generating a single thought, utterly desireless—then the spirit-qi circulates freely, and creation unfolds naturally. Laozi says: "Subtle and continuous, its use is never exhausted."

When the host of yin is entirely stripped away, the elixir ripens. Leaping from the mortal cage, one attains longevity of ten thousand years.
Ye Shibiao says: The true unity of qi is the encasement of yang. People who eat the five grains become obstructed, unable to circulate creation and destiny, so their entire bodies belong to yin. Sages forget form to nurture qi, forget qi to nurture spirit, forget spirit to nurture emptiness. Thus, *kan* and *li* wax and wane within the body, wind and clouds issue from the seven orifices, true qi flows freely, generating the elixir medicine. Exchanging bones and returning to yang, one endures as long as heaven and earth.

Fourteen
"Three, five, and one—just these three characters,
truly understood from ancient times to now, are rare indeed."

chunks.original_text: 叶士表曰：三五，十五也，一者，言三五归於一处也。 ○袁公辅曰：三者，木也，为离女朱汞。 一者，水也，为坎男白金。 五者，土也，为中官戊己之位。 《易》曰：三五与一天地精，《参同契》曰：本之但二物兮末之为三五，三五并为一兮都集应二所是也。 关子明《易传》曰：阴阳三五者，阳三阴二，相参成五，皆始生於先天一炁之中也。 东三南二同成五，北一西方四共之，戊己自居生数五，三家相见结婴儿。 叶士表曰：木数三，火数二，一五也； 金数四，水数一，二五也，土数五，三五也。 三五归一则结而成丹。 婴兑，言纯阳也。 ○无名子曰：龙属木，木数三，居束，木能生火，故龙之弦气属火。 火数二，居南，二物同元，故三与二合而成一五。 虎属金，金数四，居西，金能生水，故虎之弦气属水。 水数一，居北，二物同官，故四与一合而成二五。 二五交於戊己中官，属土，土数五，是成三五也，三五合而成丹。 丹者，一也。 此三者结成婴儿，实希有也。 婴儿是一含真炁，十月胎圆入圣基。 叶士表曰：五行聚於此处成丹，如子在胞胎，数足成形也。 超几入圣，此为基本。 十五 不识真铅正祖宗，万般作用枉施功。 休妻馒遣阴阳隔，绝粒徒教肠胃空。 叶士表曰：休妻绝粒，学道人本分事也。 真人之意恐人不识真铅，止以休妻绝粒为尽於道，故有隔阴阳、空肠胃之说。 如有妻亦不铃休，若淡然无欲，则与无妻者同矣，有食亦不铃绝，若真气满足，自然不思饮啖矣。 今人动而亡上，则止於克化而已，一气何自而生成耶？ 其问亦有谓之夫妇双修者，如刘安王、许旌阳、张同空、刘纲者，殊不知此辈闻道在有妻之后，正愚所谓不叉休也。 若果在於有妻，真人安得有自然有鼎烹龙虎，何爻担家恋子妻之句？ ○袁公辅曰：天地未分，形若鸡子中混沌真一之熙，即炁铅也，故真铅为天地万汇之先，天地既分，则一数生水，二数生火，三数生木，四数生黑铅也。 金丹之道始以水母为丹基，即汞母也，水母复生真水银，故谓之归一还源也。 真一子曰：金本生水，故谓水之母谓金，常藏形於水，乃隐子胎也。 水为金之子，谓黑铅变质之后，寄位西方，为白虎金，胎水复藏母胎中，为水银，真汞也。 ○《参同契》曰：金来归性初，乃得称还丹。 是知真铅者，即汞之祖宗也。 人能识真铅之旨而修之，即与天地齐年，其他休妻绝粒，咽纳存想之卫，皆在用工夫，与丹道殊异矣。 草木金银皆滓质，云霞日月属朦胧。 叶士表曰：草木金银，皆有质之物，云霞日月，乃客外之气，岂能回阳换烧丹，精选珠琉作大还，将谓外丹化内药，元来金石不相干。 又曰：日魂月魄天地精，探之得法尚非真，盖缘不是自家物，所以教君护苦辛。 更饶吐纳并存想，总与金丹事不同。 十六 万卷仙经话总同，金丹只此是根宗。 依他坤位生成体，种向乾家交感宫。 叶士表曰：月出於西南坤位，言药随太阴而生。 真人曰月者，药之丹是也，乾阳也。 种於乾家，以汞投铅，阴归阳室也。 ○袁公辅曰：西南坤位，乃太阴所生之方，太阴一月一周天，太阳一岁一周天，每遇朔前半夜子时，运行阳火之初，日月合璧於毕勖之上，故一岁十二次，交合生育万物也。
chunks.translated_text:
Ye Shibiao says: "Three and five make fifteen; the one means that three and five return to a single place."

Master Yuan the Auxiliary says: "Three is wood, representing the *li* maiden and cinnabar mercury. One is water, representing the *kan* man and white metal. Five is earth, representing the central palace of *wu* and *ji*. The *Book of Changes* states: 'Three, five, and one—these are the essence of heaven and earth.' The *Cantong Qi* says: 'Originally there were but two things, yet in the end they become three and five; when three and five unite as one, they all gather in response to the two.' Guan Ziming’s *Commentary on the Book of Changes* says: 'Yin and yang, three and five—yang is three, yin is two, combining to make five. All arise from the primordial unity of *qi*. East is three, south is two, together making five; north is one, west is four, sharing the same. *Wu* and *ji* reside in the generative number five. When the three families meet, the infant is formed.'

Ye Shibiao says: "Wood’s number is three, fire’s is two—this is the first five. Metal’s number is four, water’s is one—this is the second five. Earth’s number is five—this is the third five. When three and five return to one, they congeal to form the elixir. The infant is spoken of as pure yang."

The Nameless Master says: "The dragon pertains to wood, whose number is three, dwelling in the east. Wood generates fire, so the dragon’s arcane *qi* pertains to fire. Fire’s number is two, dwelling in the south. These two things share the same origin, so three and two combine to form the first five. The tiger pertains to metal, whose number is four, dwelling in the west. Metal generates water, so the tiger’s arcane *qi* pertains to water. Water’s number is one, dwelling in the north. These two things share the same office, so four and one combine to form the second five. The two fives intersect at the central palace of *wu* and *ji*, which pertains to earth, whose number is five—thus forming the third five. When the three fives unite, they form the elixir. The elixir is the one. When these three congeal to form the infant, it is truly rare. The infant is the one containing true *qi*; when the ten-month gestation is complete, one enters the foundation of sagehood."

Ye Shibiao says: "When the five phases gather in this place to form the elixir, it is like a child in the womb—when the count is full, the form is complete. Transcending the subtle to enter sagehood, this is the foundation."

Fifteen
Not knowing the true lead and its original lineage,
all efforts are vainly expended.
Severing ties with one’s wife only divides yin and yang,
fasting merely leaves the stomach and intestines empty.

Ye Shibiao says: "Severing ties with one’s wife and fasting are the proper duties of one who studies the Dao. The true person’s intent is to warn that if one does not recognize the true lead, merely severing ties and fasting are taken as exhausting the Dao—hence the sayings about dividing yin and yang and emptying the stomach and intestines. If one has a wife, there is no need to sever ties; if one is indifferent and without desire, it is the same as having no wife. If one eats, there is no need to fast; if true *qi* is full, one naturally does not think of food and drink. Nowadays, people act recklessly and lose their foundation, merely digesting and transforming—how can the one *qi* be generated and completed? Some speak of dual cultivation for husband and wife, like Liu An the King, Xu Jingsun, Zhang Tongkong, and Liu Gang. Little do they know that these individuals heard the Dao after already having wives—just as the fool says, there is no need to sever ties. If one truly remains with a wife, how could the true person have naturally possessed a crucible to refine dragon and tiger, or uttered lines about shouldering a family and cherishing children and wife?"

Master Yuan the Auxiliary says: "Before heaven and earth divided, their form was like a chicken’s egg, containing the primordial unity of true *qi*—this is the lead of *qi*. Thus, true lead is the ancestor of heaven, earth, and the ten thousand things. After heaven and earth divided, the number one generated water, two generated fire, three generated wood, and four generated black lead. The Dao of the golden elixir begins with the water mother as the foundation of the elixir—this is the mercury mother. The water mother in turn generates true quicksilver, hence it is called returning to the one and reverting to the source."

The True Unity Master says: "Metal inherently generates water, so it is called the mother of water. It constantly conceals its form in water, like a child hidden in the womb. Water is the child of metal. After black lead transforms in quality, it lodges in the west as the white tiger of metal. The fetal water again conceals the mother’s womb, becoming quicksilver—true mercury."

The *Cantong Qi* says: "When metal comes to return to its nature, it is then called the reverted elixir." Thus, the true lead is the ancestor of mercury. If one can recognize the purport of the true lead and cultivate accordingly, one’s years will equal those of heaven and earth. Other practices—severing ties with one’s wife, fasting, swallowing and absorbing, contemplation and visualization—are all methods of effort, distinct from the Dao of the elixir.

Grasses, trees, metals, and silver are all impure substances;
clouds, mist, sun, and moon belong to the realm of obscurity.

Ye Shibiao says: "Grasses, trees, metals, and silver are all material things; clouds, mist, sun, and moon are external *qi*. How could they reverse yang and refine the elixir, selecting pearls and rubies to make the great return? Those who claim that external elixirs transform internal medicine do not realize that metals and minerals are unrelated. It also says: 'The sun’s essence and moon’s spirit are the essence of heaven and earth. Even if obtained by proper methods, they are still not true. Because they are not one’s own things, they require you to guard them with bitter toil. Moreover, swallowing and absorbing, contemplation and visualization—all differ from the work of the golden elixir.'"

Sixteen
Though ten thousand volumes of immortal scriptures speak in unison,
the golden elixir alone is the root and origin.
Rely on the *kun* position to give birth to the formed body,
plant it in the *qian* household’s palace of mutual arousal.

Ye Shibiao says: "The moon emerges from the southwest *kun* position, meaning the medicine follows the great yin in its generation. The true person says the moon is the elixir medicine. *Qian* is yang. Planting it in the *qian* household means casting mercury into lead, yin returning to the yang chamber."

Master Yuan the Auxiliary says: "The southwest *kun* position is the direction where the great yin is generated. The great yin completes one circuit of the heavens each month, the great yang one circuit each year. Every time, at midnight before the new moon, at the initial movement of the yang fire, the sun and moon unite as jade discs above the *Bi* and *Xu* constellations. Thus, in the twelve stations of the year, they conjoin to give birth to the ten thousand things."

chunks.original_text: 一岁十二月，分大小尽者，盖奇耦数也，奇为阳，耦为阴。 又谓消长盈虚之理，日月皆循黄道而行，一升一降，一浮一沉，日受月化，体不亏伤也。 至三日，则月感日之魂，而纤魄生焉。 《龙虎上经》曰：神功变成震，三日，月出庚。 则乾交坤之下爻，而为震卦，故至三日现於庚方。 此《易》所谓西南得朋之时也。 卯酉为日月出入之方，金木之正位，自六日至八日而成上弦。 《龙虎上经》曰：坤再变成兑，八日，月出丁，故上弦金半斤也。 乾交坤之中爻而为兑卦，则月光得半弦，平如绳，而月现於丁方，喻鼎中金火各半也。 自十一日至十五日，三阳备矣，圆照东方甲位，谓之月望，是月魄全得日魂而满也。 至金水壮盛之时，为乾健之体，至此太阳之精盛满神室之内，金火之黑化而为汞，汞与其母两相留恋，以变金体。 蟾蛛兔魄，互相包裹，光耀鼎中，金气渐荣而变成丹也。 阳极阴将生矣，《龙虎上经》曰：十六转相喊，乾初缺成巽。 则坤交乾之下爻而为巽卦，阳火初退，阴符始生，平明则现於辛方，亦如阳火初进之时。 月生三日同也。 又曰：乾再损成艮，二十三下弦。 故下弦水半斤也，自二十一日阴符再退，至二十三日坤交乾之中爻而为艮卦，则月现於丙方，复与上弦同义。 盖鼎中金水各半也，上下两弦相合，共得一斤之数。 ○《参同契》曰：两弦合其精，乾坤体乃成是也。 又自二十六日至二十八日，坤交乾之上爻而为坤卦，月光将尽，则月现於乙方，至于束北，此《易》所谓东北丧朋之时也。 二十八日至三十日，阴符到此消尽，阴阳之气各停，土与木金和而为液，太阳之熙不合於月，则太阴之体全黑。 自此又复循环不穷矣。 夫月，纯阴也，不感日之纯阳，乌能灭而复生？ 人亦纯阴也，要得归根复命、长生久视，须是依他坤体种向乾官，以汞投铅，阴归阳室也。 岂非金丹根宗之旨乎？ ○无名子曰：至当归一，莫不以龙虎二八初弦之炁，以为丹之质。 但依坤母生成之理，逆而修之，得丹之后，种在乾父交感之官以运符火。 盖修真之要妙不出铅火二字。 至哉，平叔翁泄尽天机於此。 莫怪天机俱漏尽，都绿学者尽迷蒙。 若人了得诗中意，立见三清太上翁。 修真十书悟真篇卷之二十六竟 修真十书悟真篇卷之二十七
chunks.translated_text:
A year comprises twelve months, divided into greater and lesser periods, for they follow the numbers of odd and even—odd being yang, even being yin. This also reflects the principle of waxing and waning, fullness and emptiness. Both sun and moon traverse the ecliptic, ascending and descending, floating and sinking. The sun is transformed by the moon, yet its body remains unharmed.

By the third day, the moon receives the sun’s *hun*-soul, and its slender crescent is born. As the *Dragon-Tiger Classic* states: "Through divine transformation, *Zhen* is formed. On the third day, the moon emerges from *geng*." Here, *Qian* unites with the lower line of *Kun* to become the *Zhen* hexagram, and so on the third day it appears in the *geng* direction. This is what the *Book of Changes* calls the time of "gaining companions in the southwest."

*Mao* and *you* are the directions of the sun and moon’s rising and setting, the true positions of Metal and Wood. From the sixth to the eighth day, the first quarter is formed. The *Dragon-Tiger Classic* says: "Kun transforms again to become *Dui*. On the eighth day, the moon emerges from *ding*." Thus, the upper quarter of Metal weighs half a *jin*. *Qian* unites with the middle line of *Kun* to become the *Dui* hexagram, and the moonlight reaches half its arc, straight as a cord. The moon appears in the *ding* direction, symbolizing the cauldron in which Metal and Fire are evenly balanced.

From the eleventh to the fifteenth day, the three yang lines are complete, and the full moon shines upon the *jia* position in the east—this is called the "moon’s fullness," when the moon’s *po*-soul fully receives the sun’s *hun*-soul and becomes whole. At the time when Metal and Water are at their peak, the body of *Qian*’s vigor reaches its height. The essence of the great yang fills the inner chamber of the spirit, and Metal and Fire’s black transformation becomes mercury. Mercury and its mother linger together, altering the body of Metal. The toad and hare’s souls intertwine, their radiance illuminating the cauldron as the Metal’s *qi* gradually flourishes and transforms into the elixir.

Yang reaches its extreme, and yin is about to arise. The *Dragon-Tiger Classic* says: "On the sixteenth, the turning cry begins, and *Qian*’s initial line wanes to form *Xun*." Here, *Kun* unites with the lower line of *Qian* to become the *Xun* hexagram. The yang fire first retreats, and the yin tally begins to grow. At dawn, it appears in the *xin* direction, just as when the yang fire first advances—like the moon’s appearance on the third day.

It further states: "*Qian* diminishes again to form *Gen*. On the twenty-third, the lower quarter." Thus, the lower quarter of Water weighs half a *jin*. From the twenty-first day, the yin tally retreats again, and by the twenty-third day, *Kun* unites with the middle line of *Qian* to become the *Gen* hexagram. The moon appears in the *bing* direction, its meaning the same as the upper quarter—within the cauldron, Metal and Water are evenly balanced. The two quarters combined total one *jin*. As the *Triple Concordance* says: "When the two quarters unite their essence, the bodies of *Qian* and *Kun* are complete."

From the twenty-sixth to the twenty-eighth day, *Kun* unites with the upper line of *Qian* to become the *Kun* hexagram. The moonlight nearly fades, and the moon appears in the *yi* direction, extending toward the northeast—this is what the *Book of Changes* calls the time of "losing companions in the northeast." From the twenty-eighth to the thirtieth day, the yin tally dissipates entirely, and the *qi* of yin and yang each come to rest. Earth harmonizes with Wood and Metal to become liquid. The great yang’s brilliance no longer aligns with the moon, and the body of the great yin turns wholly dark.

From here, the cycle begins anew without end. The moon is pure yin—without the influence of the sun’s pure yang, how could it vanish and then be reborn? Humans, too, are pure yin. To return to the root and restore life, to attain longevity and enduring vision, one must follow the body of *Kun* and plant in the palace of *Qian*, casting mercury into lead so that yin returns to the yang chamber. Is this not the fundamental principle of the Golden Elixir?

The Nameless Master says: "The most fitting path returns to unity. There is none who does not take the *qi* of the Dragon and Tiger’s initial crescent as the substance of the elixir. Simply follow the principle of *Kun*-Mother’s generation, reverse the process to cultivate it, and after obtaining the elixir, plant it in the palace of *Qian*-Father’s mutual arousal to circulate the tally and fire. The essential wonder of cultivating the truth lies in nothing beyond the two words: lead and fire."

How profound! Master Pingshu has revealed the celestial mechanism in full. No wonder the celestial secrets have all been disclosed—it is because scholars remain utterly confused. If one comprehends the meaning within these verses, one will immediately behold the Three Pure Ones, the Most High Lords.

chunks.original_text: 绝句上六十四首 先把乾坤为鼎器，次传乌兔药来烹。 真一子曰：太易太素之前，含灵至妙，未见萌兆，太极太一之际，有物混成，中真一之精为天地之祖，万物之始。 一炁既形，二仪斯析。 然后有乾坤、阴阳、五行、三才、万物众名，故配乾坤为天地纪纲，运阴阳为炁造化弃钥； 是以乾坤，立而阴阳行乎其中矣。 金液大丹与造化同途，故以乾坤为鼎器，同其大冶； 以坎离为药物，比其化权。 余六十卦布为火候也。 ○《参同契》曰：乾坤者，易之门户，众卦之父母。 坎离，垣郭，运毂正轴牝杜四卦以为弃钥。 覆昌阴阳之道，犹工御者执街辔、准绳墨，随轨辙，处中以制外。 故在於历纪，月节有五六，经纬奉日，使兼并为六十四卦，刚柔有表裹。 ○《契秘图》曰：离纳己为日，为火，为心，为丹砂，为龙，为汞； 坎纳戊为月，为水，为肾，为铅，为虎，为气。 离卦内阳而外阴，外刚而内柔，赫日乃阳，玄乌乃阴，言阳中有阴也。 坎卦外阴而内阳，外柔而内刚，月魂乃阴，兔魄乃阳，言阴中有阳也。 然《北斗经疏》又云：乌三足，阳数也，兔四足，阴数也。 盖三乃木之生数，四乃金之生数，所以配木公金母也。 龙汞属木，虎铅属金，木从火出，金向水生也。 既驱二物归黄道，争得金丹不解生。 叶士表曰：二物，言前坎离所产之药，黄道中官也。 二物既得中官，得火候养育，无不成丹也。 二 安炉立鼎法乾坤，锻炼精华制魄魂。 叶士表曰：混沌未判，乾坤一六位乎上下，坎离十五位乎两闲。 太极既分，象亦如此。 故丹道法天地造化，以乾坤鼎器锻制日月也。 聚散氤氲为变化，敢将玄妙等闲论。 叶士表曰：真气需蒸，往来升降，或聚或散，不可名状。 三 休泥丹鳌费工夫，炼药须寻偃月炉。 自有天然真火用，不须柴炭及吹嘘。 叶士表曰：两肾状如偃月，中混元丹。 鼎为造化之根，有天然真阳之火，生产丹药。 ○无名子曰：叶文叔指两肾为偃月，误矣。 盖此炉之口偃仰，开如偃月之状，即阴海是也。 此中有自然真火，不须柴炭吹嘘之劳。 袁公辅曰：凭丹电以烧金炼银，破耗资财，积累成月，万无一成。 金丹之法，当以偃月为炉，用天然真火烹炼，然后可成。 ○《参同契》曰； 偃月法炉鼎，白虎为熬枢是也。 人之中官，取象太阴之魄，苟能领揽真阳之界，於内则亦如太阴生魄，惭变乾阳之体，生产丹药也。 四 偃月炉中．玉药生，朱砂鼎内水银平只因火力调和‘后，种得黄芽渐长成。 叶士表曰：玉药，药之初生者。 朱砂鼎，言水银从其中而出，用火调养，则凝结成质。 ○袁公补曰：玉药，初生自日汞，和平而致，又因火候调和，所以渐长养黄芽也。 外药还如内药，真有旨哉。 ○无名子曰：偃月炉，阴炉也。 中有玉药之阳熙，即虎之弦气也。 朱砂鼎，阳鼎也，中有水银之阴气，即龙之弦气也。 金丹，即此二火之熙调停和合之后，种得真一之气在黄家，渐渐抽芽结成黍粒矣。 五 咽津纳气是人行，有药方能造化生。 鼎内若无真种子，犹将水火煮空铛。 叶士表曰：真种子，中官金母也。 有母然后繁生，真汞造化成丹。 ○《参同契》曰：植禾当以粟，覆鸡用其子。 又曰：枝茎花叶，果实垂布，正其根株，不失其素。
chunks.translated_text:
**Sixty-Four Quatrains (Part One)**

First take Qian and Kun as the crucible and vessel,
Then transmit the Raven and Hare’s medicine for refinement.

**Master Zhenyi says:**
Before the Great Simplicity and Primal Chaos, the numinous and most subtle lay hidden without sign. At the juncture of the Great Ultimate and the Supreme One, there existed a thing undifferentiated, wherein the essence of the Central True One became the ancestor of Heaven and Earth, the origin of the myriad things.
Once qi took form, the Two Modes divided.
Thereafter arose Qian and Kun, yin and yang, the Five Phases, the Three Powers, and the names of the ten thousand things. Thus, Qian and Kun were established as the warp and woof of Heaven and Earth, while yin and yang were set in motion as the key to qi’s transformation.
The Golden Elixir shares the same path as creation, so Qian and Kun serve as the crucible and vessel, mirroring the Great Foundry; Kan and Li become the medicinal substances, paralleling the power of transformation. The remaining sixty hexagrams are arrayed as the firing times.

**The *Cantong Qi* states:**
Qian and Kun are the gate and door of the Changes, the parents of all hexagrams. Kan and Li form the outer walls, the axle and hub, with the four trigrams of the furnace and bellows as the key. They encompass the Dao of yin and yang, just as a charioteer holds the reins, follows the plumb line, and steers by the wheel tracks, governing the external from the center. Thus, in the celestial reckoning, the lunar phases number five and six, while the warp and weft attend the sun, combining to form the sixty-four hexagrams, with hardness and softness as their outer and inner aspects.

**The *Secret Diagram of the Cantong Qi* states:**
Li receives *ji* as the sun, fire, the heart, cinnabar, the dragon, and mercury. Kan receives *wu* as the moon, water, the kidneys, lead, the tiger, and qi. The Li hexagram is yang within and yin without, hard externally and soft internally—its radiant sun is yang, its dark raven is yin, signifying yang containing yin. The Kan hexagram is yin without and yang within, soft externally and hard internally—its lunar soul is yin, its hare spirit is yang, signifying yin containing yang.
Yet the *Commentary on the Northern Dipper Sutra* also says: The raven has three feet, a yang number; the hare has four feet, a yin number. Three is the generative number of wood, four the generative number of metal, thus corresponding to Wood Duke and Metal Mother. The dragon and mercury belong to wood, the tiger and lead to metal—wood emerges from fire, metal arises from water.
Once these two substances are driven into the Yellow Path,
How could the Golden Elixir fail to take form?

**Ye Shibiao says:**
The "two substances" refer to the medicine produced by the aforementioned Kan and Li, the Central Palace of the Yellow Path. Once these two attain the Central Palace and receive the nurturing of the firing times, the elixir will invariably form.

**II**
Establish the furnace and erect the crucible according to Qian and Kun,
Refine the essence and spirit to govern the hun and po.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
Before the division of primordial chaos, Qian and Kun occupied the positions of one and six above and below, while Kan and Li held the fifteenth positions between them. After the Great Ultimate divided, the pattern remained the same. Thus, the Dao of the elixir models the creation of Heaven and Earth, using Qian and Kun as the crucible and vessel to refine the sun and moon.
Gathering and dispersing, steaming and blending to transform—
How dare one treat such mysteries as common discourse?

**Ye Shibiao says:**
The true qi must be steamed, ascending and descending, now gathering, now scattering, beyond all description.

**III**
Do not waste effort on the elixir tortoise,
To refine the medicine, seek the Reclining Moon Furnace.
It possesses a natural true fire,
No need for kindling or bellows.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
The two kidneys resemble a reclining moon, with the primordial elixir within. The crucible is the root of creation, containing the natural true yang fire that generates the elixir medicine.

**The Nameless Master says:**
Ye Wenshu’s identification of the two kidneys as the Reclining Moon is mistaken. The mouth of this furnace reclines upward, open like a crescent moon—this is the Sea of Yin. Within it lies a natural true fire, requiring no labor of kindling or bellows.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
Relying on external elixirs to burn gold and refine silver wastes resources, and even after months of accumulation, success is never achieved. The method of the Golden Elixir must use the Reclining Moon as the furnace, employing the natural true fire for refinement—only then can it be accomplished.

**The *Cantong Qi* states:**
The Reclining Moon models the crucible and vessel,
With the White Tiger as the pivot of refinement.
The human Central Palace takes the image of the moon’s essence. If one can grasp the realm of true yang within, then internally it will be like the moon generating its essence, gradually transforming into the body of Qian’s yang, producing the elixir medicine.

**IV**
In the Reclining Moon Furnace, the jade medicine is born;
Within the cinnabar crucible, the mercury levels.
Only after the fire’s power harmonizes
Is the yellow sprout planted and gradually grown.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
The "jade medicine" is the medicine in its initial stage. The "cinnabar crucible" refers to mercury emerging from within it; when nurtured by fire, it congeals into substance.

**Yuan Gong adds:**
The "jade medicine" first arises from the sun’s mercury, gentle and harmonious. Through the regulation of the firing times, the yellow sprout is gradually nurtured. The external medicine resembles the internal medicine—truly profound!

**The Nameless Master says:**
The Reclining Moon Furnace is a yin furnace, containing the yang warmth of the jade medicine—this is the tiger’s latent qi. The cinnabar crucible is a yang vessel, holding the yin qi of mercury—this is the dragon’s latent qi. The Golden Elixir arises from the harmonious blending of these two fires. Once the true qi of the Supreme One is planted in the Yellow House, it gradually sprouts and forms millet grains.

**V**
Swallowing saliva and absorbing qi are human practices,
Only with medicine can creation be generated.
If the crucible lacks the true seed,
It is like boiling water and fire in an empty cauldron.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
The "true seed" is the Metal Mother of the Central Palace. Only with the mother can there be abundant generation; true mercury transforms into the elixir.

**The *Cantong Qi* states:**
Plant grain with millet,
Hatch chicks with eggs.
Branches, stems, flowers, and leaves—
The fruit hangs in abundance.
Hold fast to the root and trunk,
Lest the original substance be lost.

**VI**
To harmonize lead and mercury and form the elixir,
Neither great nor small harms the two realms’ wholeness.

Yang mercury and yin lead—yang is noble, yin is humble,
Hence the analogy of the two realms, great and small.
The sage fears that those who cultivate the elixir may err
Through excess or deficiency, or stray into partial yin or yang,
Thus he speaks of this.
If you ask what true lead is,
The toad’s glow shines all day upon the Western River.

The West is the direction of Metal;
The moon is the function of the medicine.
**Master Daoguang says:**
The toad’s glow shines all day on the darkened thoroughfare,
The moon’s leak reveals countless yellow sprouts.

Before refining the Returned Elixir, do not enter the mountains,
For within and without the mountains, lead is not to be found.
This supreme treasure exists in every household,
Yet fools, lacking full discernment, fail to recognize it.

Lead is a substance within the body,
Not to be sought in mountain forests.
Only when you know this should you enter the mountains to practice.

Abandon attachments and cast off harm,
Take refuge in the hills and mounds.
Roam the vast expanse,
Neighboring the spirits.

For refining the Golden Liquor’s divine elixir,
First, you must recognize the medicine’s root and source,
Then verify the fire’s advance and retreat.
Yang ascends, yin descends—
Never straying from the midnight and noon directions;
The sun departs, the moon arrives—
Ever bound to the positions of dawn and dusk.

chunks.original_text: 用坎离而行水火，使龙虎变作夫妻。 还尸精於月窟，则铅内产砂，戏朱雀於离官，则砂中生汞。 情性相抱，夫妻相春，自然而成金液也。 故人之情性不离於身，丹之砂汞俱生铅内，情性於人，非外物也，砂汞於铅，非杂类也。 故大丹之道，全在阴阳二炁，相须而成至药。 《丹砂诀》云； 炼神者合於至道，是知金丹不用金银、土石、草木、灰霜而造也。 八 竹破须将竹补宜，覆雏当用子为之。 万般非类徒劳力，争似真铅合圣机。 叶士表曰：几外药，如他财别姓，非。 若自己真铅气类相投也。 ○《参同契》曰：欲作服食仙，当以同类者。 类同者相从，事乖不成宝。 ○袁公辅曰：竹，非竹不可补； 鸡，非卯不可抱。 人之气血衰耗，鼎炉破败，非天地真铅之炁，不可补也。 九 用铅不得用凡铅，用了真铅也弃捐。 此是用铅真妙诀，用铅不用是诚言。 古歌曰：铅为芽母，芽为铅子，既得金花，拾铅不使。 盖铅是中官金母，繁生真汞，汞结为丹，铅则不用，如万物之种子也。 ○无名子曰：真铅即真一之气也，夫人元阳真气逐日走散，无由凝结而成圣胎，故圣人炼真铅以制之，使凝结成砂，逐日运火，渐渐添汞，汞渐多铅熙渐散，故抽铅添汞也。 十月功足，铅尽汞乾，化为金液还丹，则形化为纯阳矣。 故曰：用了真铅也弃捐。 用铅不用之语，岂有虚言哉。 十 虚心实腹义俱探，只为虚心要识心。 莫若炼铅先实腹，且教守取满堂金。 叶士表曰：虚其心，实其腹，虚心养黑，实腹养丹。 ○袁公辅曰：炼汞当先炼铅，炼铅先实其腹，则汞自生。 老子曰：虚实相通，是谓大同。 世人往往实心虚腹，与此背驰，是致死坏耳。 ○无名子曰：虚心则无我，万物皆空清，其天若也。 实腹则炼铅乾汞，无摇其精。 精者汞也，守汞以实其腹，则金玉满堂矣。 一者丹也，抱一以空其心，心空则尘不立。 方其实也，炼铅以制之，汞乾形化，于以抱一以空其心，心空神妙，与道合真。 修丹之士未炼铅金，母摇汝精，精少则还丹不成矣。 十一 梦谒西华到九天，真人授我指玄篇。 其中简易无多语，只是教人炼汞铅。 袁公辅曰：此一篇即高象先歌意，更不复注。 十二 道自虚无生一炁，便从一炁产阴阳。 阴阳再合生三体，三体重生万物昌。 叶士表曰：虚无生一炁，一熙生阴阳，阴‘阳交万物，万物生生无穷。 如人混元神室之中，一点真精为母，升降二炁，二炁交合生药，药之相生也。 ○袁公辅曰：真铅居混沌杳冥之先，始生一炁，一无生两仪，两仪生三才，三才生万物，万物生生无穷也。 十三 坎电烹轰金水方，火发昆仑阴与肠，二物若还和合了，自然丹熟遍身香。 叶士表曰：金水之方，中官也。 火发昆仑，烧山符子也。 阴与阳合，生产丹药，其味香美。 ○袁公辅曰：坎电烹轰，阴中之阳也； 火发昆仑，阳中之阴也。 二物皆已聚合於中官金水之位，药熟之后，自然香透肌骨也。 ○高象先曰：绛官蒸入肌肤红，何止遍身香而已哉？ ○无名子曰：坎电者，水中之火，谓之阴火，即虎之弦熙也。 金水方者，西北乾方，即龙是也，西北又是天门，谓之玄门。 此虎以阴中之火烹炼乾龙，龙即发昆仑之火以应之，二物之火相并和合了，则真一之精自然凝结，即时探取服之，则百骸俱理而香矣。
