To employ Kan and Li is to move water and fire,
Making dragon and tiger transform into husband and wife.
Returning the essence of the corpse to the Moon Grotto,
Then lead yields cinnabar within;
Playing with the Vermilion Bird in the Li Palace,
Then cinnabar gives birth to mercury.
Emotion and nature embrace,
Husband and wife nurture each other,
Naturally forming the Golden Liquor.

Thus, human emotion and nature do not depart from the body,
And the cinnabar and mercury of the elixir both arise within lead.
Emotion and nature in man are not external things,
Just as cinnabar and mercury in lead are not mixed kinds.
Therefore, the Great Elixir’s Dao lies entirely in the two qi of yin and yang,
Which depend on each other to form the supreme medicine.

The *Dānshā Jué* states:
Those who refine the spirit unite with the supreme Dao,
Knowing that the Golden Elixir is not made from gold, silver, earth, stone, plants, ashes, or frost.

---

As bamboo must be mended with bamboo,
So must a chick be brooded by its own kind.
All other mismatched efforts are in vain—
How can they compare to true lead uniting with the sacred mechanism?

**Ye Shibiao says:**
External medicines are like another’s wealth or a different surname—alien.
Only one’s own true lead, with qi of the same kind, will harmonize.

**The *Cantong Qi* states:**
If you wish to make an elixir for consumption,
Use only those of the same kind.
Like kinds follow one another,
While mismatched affairs fail to produce treasure.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
Bamboo cannot be mended except with bamboo;
A chicken cannot be hatched except at dawn.
When a person’s qi and blood decline and the cauldron and furnace decay,
Only the true qi of Heaven and Earth can restore them.

---

Do not use common lead—use true lead,
And when true lead is spent, discard it.
This is the true and wondrous secret of using lead:
To use lead is not to use it—these are truthful words.

An ancient song says:
Lead is the mother of the sprout,
The sprout is the child of lead.
Once the golden flower is obtained,
Lead is no longer employed.
For lead is the Golden Mother of the Central Palace,
Who gives birth to true mercury;
When mercury congeals into the elixir,
Lead is then set aside—
Like the seed of the myriad things.

**Wumingzi says:**
True lead is the qi of the True One.
As a person’s original yang qi scatters daily,
It cannot congeal to form the sacred embryo.
Thus, the sage refines true lead to restrain it,
Causing it to congeal into cinnabar.
Day by day, fire is applied,
Gradually adding mercury.
As mercury increases, lead’s qi gradually disperses—
Hence, lead is withdrawn and mercury is added.
After ten months of work, lead is exhausted and mercury is dried,
Transforming into the Golden Liquor Returned Elixir,
And the form becomes purely yang.
Thus it is said:
When true lead is spent, it is discarded.
The saying “use lead, do not use it”—how could it be empty words?

---

To empty the heart and fill the abdomen—both meanings are profound,
Yet emptying the heart is only to recognize the heart.
Better to first fill the abdomen by refining lead,
And thus guard the gold that fills the hall.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
Empty the heart, fill the abdomen—
Empty the heart to nurture the mysterious,
Fill the abdomen to nurture the elixir.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
To refine mercury, first refine lead;
To refine lead, first fill the abdomen,
Then mercury will arise naturally.

**Laozi says:**
Emptiness and fullness communicate—
This is called the Great Harmony.
People often fill the heart and empty the abdomen,
Going against this principle,
Which leads to death and decay.

**Wumingzi says:**
An empty heart means no self,
All things are void and clear—
This is the state of Heaven.
A full abdomen means refining lead to dry mercury,
Preventing the essence from scattering.
Essence is mercury;
Guard mercury to fill the abdomen,
And gold and jade will fill the hall.
The One is the elixir—
Embrace the One to empty the heart,
And when the heart is empty, dust does not settle.
Then, in its fullness,
Refine lead to restrain it,
Drying mercury and transforming the form.
Thus, embrace the One to empty the heart,
And when the heart is empty, the spirit is wondrous,
Uniting with the Dao in truth.
Those who practice the elixir but have not refined lead and gold,
Do not scatter your essence—
If essence is lacking, the Returned Elixir will not form.

---

In a dream, I visited Xihua and ascended to the Nine Heavens,
Where an immortal bestowed upon me the *Zhixuan Pian*.
Its words are simple and few,
Teaching only the refinement of mercury and lead.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
This passage echoes the meaning of Gao Xiangxian’s song—
No further annotation is needed.

---

The Dao arises from emptiness and nothingness, giving birth to the One Qi,
Which then produces yin and yang.
Yin and yang unite to form the Three Bodies,
And the Three Bodies give rise to the flourishing of the myriad things.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
Emptiness gives birth to the One Qi,
The One Qi gives birth to yin and yang,
Yin and yang interact to produce the myriad things,
And the myriad things generate endlessly.
Within the primordial spirit chamber of a person,
A single speck of true essence is the mother.
The ascending and descending qi,
When they interact, give birth to the medicine—
Thus the medicine generates itself.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
True lead resides before the dim and obscure primordial chaos,
First giving birth to the One Qi.
The One gives birth to the Two Modes,
The Two Modes give birth to the Three Powers,
The Three Powers give birth to the myriad things,
And the myriad things generate endlessly.

---

The Kan thunder roars, refining the Golden Water formula,
Fire erupts from Kunlun, uniting yin and yang.
When these two things harmonize,
The elixir naturally ripens, and fragrance permeates the body.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
The Golden Water formula is the Central Palace.
Fire erupts from Kunlun—
This is the burning mountain talisman.
When yin and yang unite,
They produce the elixir,
Whose flavor is fragrant and sweet.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
The Kan thunder roars—this is the yang within yin;
Fire erupts from Kunlun—this is the yin within yang.
When these two things gather and unite in the Golden Water position of the Central Palace,
After the medicine ripens,
Fragrance naturally permeates the bones and flesh.

**Gao Xiangxian says:**
The Crimson Palace steams into the reddened skin—
How could it be merely fragrance permeating the body?

**Wumingzi says:**
The Kan thunder is the fire within water—
This is the yin fire, the bowstring qi of the tiger.
The Golden Water formula is the northwest Qian direction—
This is the dragon,
And the northwest is also the Gate of Heaven,
Called the Mysterious Gate.
Here, the tiger uses the fire within yin to refine the Qian dragon,
And the dragon then emits the fire of Kunlun to respond.
When the fires of these two things merge and harmonize,
The essence of the True One naturally congeals.
At that moment, gather and consume it,
And all the bones will be ordered, and fragrance will arise.

chunks.original_text: 既饵丹后，复运阴阳符火，虎以阴中之火烁此玄门也，龙即发昆仑之火以应之，一物合和了，则金液还丹自然成熟，满身增辉而香美矣。 此咏内外二象也。 十四 离坎若还无戊己，虽含四象不成丹。 只绿彼此怀真土，遂使金丹有返还。 叶士表曰：离为火，火从木生。 坎为水，水自金出。 坎离虽含四象，不得戊己中熙往来升降，终不能生产神丹矣。 《参同契》曰：坎戊月精，离己日光。 盖坎离纳戊己也。 ○袁公辅曰：坎藏六戊，为月之精，雄阳之位，居於北方。 月，阴也，戊，阳也，乃阴中之阳，象水中之生金虎也。 离藏六己，为日之光雌，阴之位，居於南方日阳也，己，阴也，乃阳中之阴，象火中之生汞龙也，《参同契》曰：坎戊月精，离己日光。 《龙虎上经》曰； 坎，雄金精，离，雌火光是也。 日月若无戊己中黑往来升降，虽含四象之炁，不能生产神丹、明照宇宙。 人能会返还之理，使戊己正位，召集三光五行之气，生产丹药，亦能长生久视矣。 ○无名子曰：离己日光，坎戊月精。 故离之己，象龙之弦无也，坎之戊，象虎之弦炁也。 龙虎怀戊己之真土，是以龙虎交，而戊己合为一体，四象会而丹成也。 故曰返还。 十五 日居离位翻为女，坎配蟾宫却是男。 不会个中颠倒意，休将管见事高谈。 叶士表曰：离为日，中有毕月乌，外阳而内阴也。 坎为月，中有房日兔，外阴而内阳也。 故离纳己坎纳戊。 ○袁公辅曰：日中有毕月乌，阳中有阴也，月中有房日兔，阴中有阳也。 万物生于天地问，类皆如此，苟或不然，终不能造化生成。 学道之士不能会此中颠倒之意，区区恃颊舌之辞者，甚无谓也。 十六 取将坎位中心实，点化离宫腹裹阴。 从此变成乾健体，潜藏飞跃尽由心。 袁公辅曰：坎交离之中爻，则成乾卦。 坎为月，离为日。 ○《参同契》曰：日受月化也，而乾龙变化，潜藏飞跃，皆自中爻。 则人之变化超凡亦由真土也。 ○无名子曰：离外阳而内阴，坎外阴而内阳，以内阳点内阴，即成乾卦，喻如金丹是至阳之炁，号日阳丹，结在阴海之中，取来点己之阴汞，即化为纯阳之身，然后运火抽添进退，皆由我心之运用也。 十七 震龙汞自出离乡，兑虎铅生在坎方。 二物总因儿产母，五行全要入中央。 叶士表曰：离火生木汞，坎水生金铅，母忆子胎也。 不得中官，不能钻簇。 ○袁公辅曰：木本生火为母，金本生水为母，今震龙却出於离，兑虎却出於坎者，乃母隐子胎也。 二物总因两相慕恋，类倒而得，若又非五行之黑钻簇於中官，亦不能成。 ○无名子曰：汞为震龙属木，木为火母，火为木子，此常道之顺五行也。 ＇然朱砂属火，为离，汞自砂中生，却是火反生木！ 故日儿产母，此五行之类倒衍也。 铅为兑虎，属金，金为水母，水为金子，此常道之顺五行也。 然炁铅属水，为坎，银自铅中生，却是水反生金，故日儿产母，此亦五行之类倒衍也。 不言银者，铅中银谓之真铅。 中央下丹田，大中极也。 十八
chunks.translated_text:
After consuming the elixir, once more circulate the fire of the yin-yang talisman. The tiger employs the fire within yin to refine this Mysterious Gate, and the dragon then emits the fire of Kunlun in response. When these two things merge and harmonize, the Golden Liquor Returned Elixir naturally ripens, and the entire body radiates brilliance and fragrance. This describes the inner and outer images.

**Fourteen**
If Li and Kan lack the wu-ji,
Though they contain the Four Images, the elixir will not form.
Only because each harbors the True Earth,
Can the Golden Elixir achieve return and restoration.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
Li is fire, and fire is born of wood.
Kan is water, and water issues from metal.
Though Kan and Li contain the Four Images,
Without the wu-ji’s central qi ascending and descending between them,
They can never produce the divine elixir.
The *Cantong Qi* states: “Kan’s wu is the moon’s essence; Li’s ji is the sun’s light.”
For Kan and Li receive wu and ji.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
Kan conceals the six wu, the moon’s essence,
The position of yang within yang, residing in the north.
The moon is yin, while wu is yang—
This is yang within yin, like the metal tiger born within water.
Li conceals the six ji, the sun’s light,
The position of yin within yang, residing in the south.
The sun is yang, while ji is yin—
This is yin within yang, like the mercury dragon born within fire.
The *Cantong Qi* states: “Kan’s wu is the moon’s essence; Li’s ji is the sun’s light.”
The *Longhu Shangjing* says:
“Kan is the essence of male metal; Li is the light of female fire.”
If the sun and moon lack the wu-ji’s central darkness ascending and descending between them,
Though they contain the qi of the Four Images,
They cannot produce the divine elixir or illuminate the cosmos.
One who comprehends the principle of return and restoration,
Aligning wu and ji in their proper positions,
Can summon the qi of the Three Lights and Five Phases,
Produce the elixir,
And thereby attain longevity and enduring vision.

**Wumingzi says:**
“Li’s ji is the sun’s light; Kan’s wu is the moon’s essence.”
Thus, Li’s ji resembles the dragon’s bowstring qi,
And Kan’s wu resembles the tiger’s bowstring qi.
When dragon and tiger embrace the True Earth of wu and ji,
They unite as one body,
The Four Images converge, and the elixir is formed—
Hence it is called “return and restoration.”

**Fifteen**
The sun dwelling in Li’s position becomes female;
The moon paired with the Toad Palace is male.
If one fails to grasp this principle of inversion,
Do not presume to discourse on such lofty matters with mere superficial understanding.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
Li is the sun, containing the Moon Crow within—
Outwardly yang, inwardly yin.
Kan is the moon, containing the Sun Hare within—
Outwardly yin, inwardly yang.
Thus, Li receives ji, and Kan receives wu.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
The sun contains the Moon Crow—yang within yin.
The moon contains the Sun Hare—yin within yang.
All things born between heaven and earth follow this pattern;
Otherwise, they cannot be transformed and generated.
If a student of the Dao fails to comprehend this principle of inversion,
Relying instead on empty words and clever arguments,
It is utterly meaningless.

**Sixteen**
Take the solid center from Kan’s position,
And use it to transmute the yin within Li’s belly.
From this, it transforms into the vigorous body of Qian,
And all hidden and manifest movements become subject to the heart’s will.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
When Kan’s central line interchanges with Li’s,
It forms the Qian trigram.
Kan is the moon; Li is the sun.
The *Cantong Qi* states: “The sun receives the moon’s transformation,”
And the Qian dragon’s transformations—its hidden and manifest movements—
All arise from the central line.
Thus, a person’s transformations and transcendence of the ordinary
Also depend on the True Earth.

**Wumingzi says:**
Li is outwardly yang and inwardly yin;
Kan is outwardly yin and inwardly yang.
Using the inner yang to transmute the inner yin
Forms the Qian trigram.
This is like the Golden Elixir—
The utmost yang qi, called the Yang Elixir—
Congealing within the Sea of Yin.
When taken to transmute one’s own yin mercury,
It becomes a body of pure yang.
Thereafter, the regulation of fire, the withdrawal and addition of qi,
And all progress and retreat
Are governed by the heart’s operation.

**Seventeen**
The Zhen dragon’s mercury emerges from Li’s domain;
The Dui tiger’s lead is born in Kan’s direction.
These two things arise because the child produces the mother,
And the Five Phases all depend on entering the center.

**Ye Shibiao says:**
Li fire gives birth to wood mercury;
Kan water gives birth to metal lead—
The mother cherishes the child’s embryo.
Without the Central Palace, they cannot be gathered and refined.

**Yuan Gongfu says:**
Wood originally gives birth to fire as its mother;
Metal originally gives birth to water as its mother.
Yet the Zhen dragon emerges from Li,
And the Dui tiger emerges from Kan—
This is the mother concealing the child’s embryo.
These two things arise from mutual longing and attraction,
Inverted to achieve their union.
If the qi of the Five Phases does not gather and refine within the Central Palace,
They cannot be formed.

**Wumingzi says:**
Mercury is the Zhen dragon, belonging to wood.
Wood is the mother of fire, and fire is the child of wood—
This is the ordinary sequence of the Five Phases.
Yet cinnabar belongs to fire, which is Li,
And mercury is born from cinnabar—
This is fire giving birth to wood in reverse!
Hence it is called “the child producing the mother,”
An inversion of the Five Phases’ sequence.
Lead is the Dui tiger, belonging to metal.
Metal is the mother of water, and water is the child of metal—
This is the ordinary sequence of the Five Phases.
Yet qi-lead belongs to water, which is Kan,
And silver is born from lead—
This is water giving birth to metal in reverse!
Hence it is also called “the child producing the mother,”
Another inversion of the Five Phases’ sequence.
It does not mention silver because the silver within lead is called True Lead.
The center is the Lower Elixir Field,
The Great Central Ultimate.

chunks.translated_text:
The Red Dragon and Black Tiger meet in east and west,
The Four Symbols intertwine within the central Wu and Ji.
Once conception occurs and movement begins,
Who can say the Golden Elixir will not succeed?

Ye Shibiao says: Though the Red Dragon and Black Tiger bear names of east and west, they both arise from the central qi of Wu and Ji. If one can employ the ascending and descending movements of the hexagrams Zi and Wu, there is nothing that will not succeed.

Wang Dao’s commentary on the *Dragon-Tiger Classic* states: The sun has three illuminations, the moon has three shifts. When the sun and moon emerge in the east and shine in the west, the true brilliance of the White Tiger’s metal virtue in the west enters into the profound darkness and transforms into the six Wu. When the sun and moon emerge in the west and shine in the east, the true brilliance of the Green Dragon’s wood virtue in the east enters into the profound darkness and transforms into the six Ji. When the sun and moon align at noon and shine in the north, the true qi of the Vermilion Bird’s fire virtue in the south enters into the profound darkness, takes form in earth, and transforms into black lead, ever residing at the primal origin of heaven and earth, becoming the root of all things in the cosmos.

The *Cantong Qi* says: The sun conceals its path yet radiates its splendor; the moon bestows its virtue and unfolds its light. The sun receives the moon’s transformation without harm to its body. If those who cultivate the Elixir can clearly understand the ascending and descending movements of the hexagrams Fu and Gou, then there is no reason the Golden Elixir will not be achieved.

The Nameless Master says: When the Four Symbols intertwine within Wu and Ji, they congeal the essence of True Unity. Obtaining this single grain of true essence, after ingestion, one begins to circulate the fire starting from the Zi hour of the Fu hexagram, advancing the Yang fire until the Wu hour of the Gou hexagram, then advancing the Yin tally. Fu is the first hexagram of Yin and Yang, corresponding to the solstices of winter and summer. From this point, the Yin tally and Yang fire begin, with extraction and addition employed in accordance with the method, ensuring no deviation. Who then can say the work of the Golden Elixir will not succeed?

chunks.original_text: 西山白虎正猖狂，东海青龙不可当。 两兽捉来令死斗，炼成一块紫金霜。 叶士表曰：铅象金水虎者，况而在下者也，汞象木火龙者，浮而在上者也。 二物相擒制伏，则化为紫金丹药也。 两兽者，龙虎也。 二十 华岳山头雄虎啸，扶桑海底牝龙吟。 叶士表曰； 华岳，西方也，扶桑，束方也。 虎龙各自其所生之乡而动也。 ○袁公辅曰：华岳，雄虎，阴中阳也。 扶桑，牝龙，阳中阴也。 《参同契》曰：坎离精光，阳戊阴已，两土合圭，黄道通理。 黄婆自解相媒合，遣作夫妻共一心。 叶士表曰：黄婆，戊己也，能使龙虎配合而为夫妻也。 《古文龙虎经》曰：土居官中，笼罩四方，三光合度，以至太平。 二十一 月才天际半输明，早有龙吟虎啸声。 袁公辅曰：月至上弦，金水各半，为阴阳两停之时其中已龙吟虎啸也。 便好用心修二八，一时辰内管丹成。 袁公辅曰：既官上弦，又须待下弦，方合二八一斤之数。 ○《参同契》曰：上弦兑数八，下弦数亦八，两弦合其精，乾坤体乃成。 便宜则而修之，金丹之妙，不在三年九载之遥，於一时之内便见玄珠形兆矣。 是宜古仙上圣促於一时之问者，此之谓也。 ○无名子曰：月之半轮者，一八之数也，仙翁指示龙虎皆一八之数，合成二八也，此时水源至清，有熙无质也。 一年之中止有一日，一日之中止有一时，一时之中分为六候，下工不出两侯，立得金丹一粒服饵。 余四候别有妙用，此皆天机，仙翁不敢成文漏露，但寓意在篇中，混而言之日．．一时辰内管丹成。 二十二 先且观天明五贼，次须察地以安民。
chunks.translated_text:
When the White Tiger of Western Mountain rages unchecked,
The Azure Dragon of Eastern Sea cannot be withstood.
Seize these two beasts and make them fight to the death,
To refine a single lump of purple-golden frost.

Ye Shibiao says: Lead, like metal-water, is the Tiger—substantial and below. Mercury, like wood-fire, is the Dragon—volatile and above. When these two subdue and restrain each other, they transform into the elixir of purple-gold. The two beasts are none other than Dragon and Tiger.

At the peak of Mount Hua, the mighty Tiger roars;
In the depths of Fusang Sea, the female Dragon hums.
Ye Shibiao says: Mount Hua lies in the West, Fusang in the East. Tiger and Dragon each stir from their native realms.

Yuan Gongfu says: Mount Hua’s Tiger is Yang within Yin; Fusang’s Dragon is Yin within Yang. The *Cantong Qi* states: "The radiance of Kan and Li, Yang as Wu and Yin as Ji, when the two earths unite as one, the Yellow Way reveals its principle. The Yellow Dame herself mediates their match, sending them to become husband and wife with a single heart."
Ye Shibiao says: The Yellow Dame is Wu and Ji, who enable Dragon and Tiger to unite as husband and wife. The *Ancient Text of the Dragon and Tiger* states: "Earth dwells at the center, enveloping the four directions. The Three Lights harmonize their measures, bringing about great peace."

As the moon first reveals half its brightness at the sky’s edge,
The roars of Dragon and Tiger resound without delay.
Yuan Gongfu says: When the moon reaches its first quarter, metal and water are evenly balanced—this is the moment when Yin and Yang stand in perfect equipoise, and Dragon and Tiger already roar within it. Now is the time to devote oneself to cultivating the two eights, for within a single double-hour the elixir will be accomplished.
Yuan Gongfu says: Having reached the first quarter, one must wait for the last quarter to complete the measure of two eights making one pound.

The *Cantong Qi* states:
"The first quarter holds the number eight,
The last quarter holds the number eight as well.
When the two quarters merge their essence,
The body of Qian and Kun is perfected."
Thus one should proceed with cultivation at once. The marvel of the Golden Elixir does not lie in three years or nine cycles but reveals the form of the Mysterious Pearl within a single double-hour. This is why the ancient immortals and supreme sages hastened to seize the moment—this is what they meant.

The Nameless Master says: The half-moon represents the number eight. The immortal elder points out that both Dragon and Tiger correspond to the number eight, combining to form sixteen. At this time, the source of water is utterly clear, possessing brilliance without substance. In a single year, there is but one day; in a single day, but one double-hour; within that double-hour, six periods are divided. Without exceeding two periods, one may refine and ingest a single grain of the Golden Elixir. The remaining four periods serve other wondrous purposes—these are celestial secrets, which the immortal elder dared not commit to explicit text but embedded within the passage, vaguely referring to it as "within a single double-hour the elixir is accomplished."

First observe the heavens to discern the Five Thieves,
Then examine the earth to pacify the people.

chunks.translated_text:
When the people are at peace and the nation prosperous, only then may one seek battle; only after battle is concluded may one behold the sagely ruler.

The Five Thieves are the Five Stars in heaven and the Five Phases in man. They are called "thieves" because their appearances and concealments are unfathomable. If one can comprehend these five, one may seize the wondrous workings of Heaven and Earth.

The land is oneself. The people are the spirits within the body. When the spirits are at peace, qi and blood harmonize; only then may one proceed with the work, advancing the fire to battle the yin ghosts. When the yin ghosts retreat, the emperor within the self reigns in effortless ease.

The *Cantong Qi* states: "The emperor and king govern eternally, enduring through a thousand autumns."

chunks.original_text: 大凡临阵休轻敌，恐丧吾家无价珍。 叶士表曰：此论二物交感，如用将分其左右主客，以真铅为主，於内运离汞，自外而入也。 老子曰：祸莫大於轻敌，轻敌则丧吾家之宝。 此言运火抽添不可不慎也。 ○袁公辅曰：此一章真人以用将主宾为戒为喻，将之用兵，苟不分为行阵，纷乱无统纪，分一军为左右者，然后可以教阵而取胜。 本以阴阳二者为喻，'’不复更为五军之文，苟两军不一，叉致败蛆矣。 客之见主，当容貌端庄，进止恭肃，故能致主人之尊礼。 若举措仓惶，语言错杂，则铃为所鄙矣。 运火亦然，从其在彼者为主，我为宾客，但符火不失其节，阴阳不致於偏，安神定息，一念不起，绵绵若存，用之不勤而已，又奚致於丧失耶？ ○无名子曰：此篇明火候作用也。 将者，火也，左为文火，右为武火。 夫运火，自子至巳六辰为阳，象春夏发生之德，故文火居左，谓之阳火； 自午至亥六辰为阴，象秋冬肃杀之刑，故武火居右，谓之阴符。 火，主为阳而雄，好争，宾为阴而雌，好静。 饶他为主我为宾，即是守雌而不雄，持静而不争，此虑险防危之意也。 喻如宾之见主，进退恭馑，而不敢妄动也。 夫运火者先定刻漏，以分子午，次接阴阳，以为化基。 般六十四卦於阴符，鼓二十四气於阳火，天关在手，地轴形心，曰七十二候之要津，钻归鼎内，夺三千六百之正气二辐嗅胎中，谨戒抽添，精专运用，虑其危，防其险，不使一项刻参差，分毫差武，故得外接阴阳之电符，内生真一之体。 苟或运心不馑，骗节候差殊，即妮女逃亡，灵胎不结，而还丹无价之宝失矣。 二十四 木生於火本藏锋，不会钻研莫强攻。 祸发只因斯害己，要须制伏觅金翁。 叶士表曰：此言自铅取汞也。 汞藏铅中不见其形，如火生於木，不见其.明也。 若不得抽添之法，莫强攻取，恐有害也。 盖祸息之发，绿火候不慎，要须得金母在内，然后汞见铅伏，若无其主汞复何求。 ○袁公辅曰：木中生火，盖木得火而旺，为木之精魂，本以藏其锐，不欢发见於外，苟有所动，则反为木之所焚矣。 可《阴符经》曰：火生於木，祸发铃克； 奸生於国，时动铃溃。 知之修炼，谓之圣人。 欲得木之镇静，须假金以伐之。 《参同契》曰：金伐木荣是也。 二十五 金翁本是东家子，送向西邻寄体生。 叶士表曰：金翁，铅也。 铅乃白金之母，始因汞凝结而成，故日束家子也。 以五行言之，金受胎於卯。 西邻者，月三日生魄於西方也。 ○无名子个：青龙白虎，俱是真一之精，变为二物，分位束西，实同出而异名也。 真一精属汞，汞为龙，在束。 白 虎本是真一精之子，寄体西方也。 认得唤来归舍养，配将诧女作亲情。 叶士表曰：知铅因汞所产，藏於中官，复运灵汞入而配合也。 二十六 诧女游从自有方，前行须短退须长。 叶士表曰：此言真汞随太阴而生，自有方位须索也。 短，阴爻也，长，阳爻也。 午前索阴而为阳，午后索阳而为阴，如坤化为复，乾化为娠之类是也。 ○袁公辅曰：妮女，木汞也，而与之游从者，乃太阴，言汞随太阴而生，自有方位，自三日月现庚·方，至上弦初八，只居于五六日之闲，岂非前行须短乎？ ，复自十五至细二十三下弦，却乃在八九日之后，岂非退行须长乎？

In all matters of battle, never underestimate the enemy,
lest you lose the priceless treasure of our house.
Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of the mutual resonance of two substances, akin to deploying generals by dividing them into left and right, host and guest—taking true lead as the host and circulating inner fire to draw in the outer mercury.

Laozi says: No misfortune is greater than underestimating the enemy; to do so is to lose the treasure of one’s house. This warns that the regulation of fire, its withdrawal and addition, must be handled with utmost care.

Yuan Gongfu says: In this chapter, the Perfected One uses the analogy of host and guest in military deployment as a caution. When generals command troops, if they do not divide them into formations, chaos ensues without order. Only by splitting the army into left and right can one drill formations and secure victory. This originally serves as a metaphor for yin and yang. Had it further divided into five armies, discord would have led to defeat. When the guest meets the host, demeanor must be dignified, movements reverent and solemn—only then can the host extend due respect. If actions are hasty and words disordered, one will surely be despised. The same applies to regulating fire: let what is there be the host, while I remain the guest. As long as fire adheres to its rhythm and yin-yang remains balanced, the spirit settles, breath steadies, not a single thought arises, and continuity persists without strain—how then could loss occur?

Master Wumingzi says: This passage clarifies the application of fire timing. The general is fire; the left is civil fire, the right is martial fire. In firing, from *zi* to *si* (the six yang hours) corresponds to spring and summer’s generative virtue, hence civil fire resides on the left, called yang fire. From *wu* to *hai* (the six yin hours) mirrors autumn and winter’s stern punishment, hence martial fire resides on the right, called yin tally. Fire, as host, is yang and masculine, fond of contention; the guest, as yin and feminine, prefers stillness. "Let the other be host while I remain guest" means embracing the feminine without striving, maintaining stillness without contention—this is the intent to guard against peril and prevent danger. It is like a guest meeting the host: advancing and retreating with reverence, never daring to act rashly.

In regulating fire, first set the water clock to distinguish *zi* and *wu*, then harmonize yin and yang to establish the foundation for transformation. Distribute the sixty-four hexagrams within the yin tally, animate the twenty-four qi with yang fire. The celestial pivot rests in the hand, the earthly axis takes form in the heart—this is the key ford of the seventy-two seasonal nodes. Bore into the crucible, seize the three thousand six hundred breaths of primal qi, and infuse them into the embryo’s core. Be vigilant in withdrawal and addition, concentrate on the operation, guard against danger, prevent peril, ensuring not a single moment is misaligned nor a fraction of a degree amiss. Thus, externally, one harmonizes with the lightning tally of yin and yang; internally, the body of true unity is born. If, however, the mind is not reverent and the rhythm of the nodes is disrupted, the maiden flees, the numinous embryo fails to form, and the priceless treasure of the returned elixir is lost.

Twenty-Four
Wood gives birth to fire, yet its edge remains concealed;
Without knowing how to drill and refine, do not forcefully attack.
Disaster arises from this self-inflicted harm—
One must seek the Metal Elder to subdue it.

Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of extracting mercury from lead. Mercury hides within lead, unseen in form, just as fire is born from wood yet its brightness remains hidden. Without the method of withdrawal and addition, do not forcefully extract it, lest harm ensue. For disasters and calamities arise from carelessness in fire timing. One must first have the Metal Mother within; only then will mercury appear and lead be subdued. Without this host, what can mercury seek?

Yuan Gongfu says: Fire is born from wood, for wood thrives with fire as its vital spirit, inherently concealing its sharpness, reluctant to manifest externally. If stirred, it will instead be consumed by the very wood it inhabits. As the *Yin Fu Jing* states: Fire arises from wood, and disaster inevitably follows; treachery arises in the state, and collapse comes with movement. Those who understand this in cultivation are called sages. To attain the tranquility of wood, one must borrow metal to fell it. As the *Cantong Qi* says: Metal fells wood to flourish.

Twenty-Five
The Metal Elder is originally the Eastern House’s son,
Sent to the Western Neighbor to lodge and take form.

Ye Shibiao says: The Metal Elder is lead. Lead is the mother of white metal, formed by the coagulation of mercury, hence called the Eastern House’s son. In the five phases, metal is conceived in *mao*. The Western Neighbor refers to the moon’s third-day crescent appearing in the west.

Master Wumingzi says: The Green Dragon and White Tiger are both the essence of true unity, transformed into two substances, occupying east and west—truly the same in origin yet different in name. True unity’s essence belongs to mercury; mercury is the Dragon, in the east. The White Tiger is originally the child of true unity’s essence, lodging in the west.

Recognize it, summon it back to the chamber to nurture,
And pair it with the maiden to forge kinship.

Ye Shibiao says: Knowing that lead is produced by mercury and stored in the Central Palace, one then circulates numinous mercury inward to unite with it.

Twenty-Six
The maiden wanders with her own direction—
Advance must be brief, retreat must be long.

Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of true mercury following the Great Yin to be born, inherently possessing its own direction and sequence. "Brief" is the yin line; "long" is the yang line. Before noon, seek yin to become yang; after noon, seek yang to become yin—like *kun* transforming into *fu* or *qian* into *gou*.

Yuan Gongfu says: The maiden is Wood Mercury. What she wanders with is the Great Yin. Mercury follows the Great Yin to be born, possessing its own direction. From the third day, when the moon reveals its *geng* phase, until the first quarter on the eighth day, it resides only within the span of five or six days—is this not "advance must be brief"? Then, from the fifteenth to the twenty-third, the waning moon lingers beyond eight or nine days—is this not "retreat must be long"?

chunks.original_text: 前而短，退而长，阳而阴，阴而阳，如此方能生生不穷。 真人种种开说，只是论一中字。 ○无名子曰：妮女，汞也，谓之汞火。 游从有方者，前行是外药作用，一时中用两候，故云须短，后行是内药作用，一时中用四侯，故云须长。 有此两用，故曰自有方．。 圣人下工炼金丹之初，运汞火不出半个时辰，立得真一之精，大如黍米者吞服，故日前行须短也。 及乎服丹之后，又运己汞火，却有十月之功，故曰后须长也。 归来却人黄婆会，嫁个金前作老郎。 叶士表曰：灵汞游从上下，归於中官，与铅配合，亦结为铅。 ○袁公补曰．．一月数终，复归于坤。 嫁个金翁者，言阴汞又来，随阳铅生没，循环无穷也。 王道云：开辟已来，循环无端，可谓老郎矣。 二十七 纵识朱砂及黑铅，不知火候也如闲心大都全藉维持力，毫发差殊不作丹。 叶士表曰：虽知朱砂产汞，黑铅生银，不知火候，亦不能生成造化。 盖元精者，鼎中神灵真精，天地之炁，视之不见，搏之不得，而能港随化机，生成万物。 既杳冥之难测，叉立符证以则之，倘或汞铅不定，分两违则，刚柔亢行，不相投入，则丹不成矣。 故真一子曰：或阳火过刻，水旱不调，则凝冬变为大暑。 或阴符失节，寒暖相侵，则盛夏反为浓霜。 金官既砂汞之不萌，一鼎则虫螟互起，大则山崩地圯，金虎与木龙沸腾，小则雨暴风飘，坎男共离女奔逸，以此观之，纵识铅汞二物，不晓火候，亦徒然耳。 ○王道曰：金液神丹全在火候，火是药之父母，药是火之子孙。 ○魏师吕曰：夫能尽性命之道者，无出於黄帝金丹。 金丹之妙，在乎火记，火记之妙，象乎坎离相交而生变化神明也。 是知铅汞非火候不能成丹明矣。 昔崔翁授吕真人以《天元入药镜》，是铃令究其火功，学者当宜尽心。 二十八 契论经歌讲至真，不将火候着於文。 要知口诀通玄处，须共神仙子细论。 道光禅师曰：圣人传药不传火，从来火候少人知，莫将大道为儿戏，须共神仙子细推。 是知火侯非遇至人。 传心授，不可晓会。 ○无名子曰：火记六百篇，篇篇相似，出入贯穿，与天合度。 天之所秘，圣莫传之，遭遇尊师，勿自卤莽。 二十九
chunks.translated_text:
The advance must be brief, the retreat must be long; from yang to yin, from yin to yang—only thus can generation be inexhaustible. The True Man expounds in myriad ways, yet speaks only of the character "center."

Master Wuming says: The maiden is mercury, called "mercury fire." That which wanders with direction—its advance is the work of the outer medicine, employing two *hou* within one *shi*, hence "must be brief"; its retreat is the work of the inner medicine, employing four *hou* within one *shi*, hence "must be long." With these two functions, it is said to possess its own direction. When the sage first begins to refine the golden elixir, moving the mercury fire for no more than half a *shi*, he immediately obtains the essence of the True One, as large as a millet grain, to be swallowed—thus the advance must be brief. After ingesting the elixir, he again moves his own mercury fire, requiring the work of ten months—thus the retreat must be long.

Returning, he enters the Yellow Dame’s chamber,
Marrying the golden elder to become the old groom.

Ye Shibiao says: The numinous mercury wanders above and below, returning to the central palace to unite with lead, also congealing into lead.

Yuan Gongfu adds: When the monthly reckoning ends, it returns to *kun*. "Marrying the golden elder" means yin mercury once more follows the birth and dissolution of yang lead, cycling endlessly.

Wang Dao says: Since the beginning of creation, it has cycled without end—truly, he may be called the old groom.

27.
Even if you recognize cinnabar and black lead,
Without knowing the fire-timing, it is as idle as a distracted mind.
The great work relies entirely on sustaining power;
A hair’s deviation, and the elixir will not form.

Ye Shibiao says: Though you know cinnabar produces mercury and black lead generates silver, without knowing the fire-timing, you cannot bring about transformation. For the primordial essence is the divine spirit and true essence within the crucible, the qi of Heaven and Earth—unseen, untouchable, yet able to respond to the mechanism of change and generate the myriad things. Since it is profoundly obscure and difficult to fathom, one must establish symbolic verification to regulate it. If mercury and lead are unstable, their weights deviate, hardness and softness act in excess, failing to interpenetrate, then the elixir will not form.

Thus True One says: If the yang fire exceeds its mark, water and drought become unbalanced, and freezing winter turns into scorching summer. If the yin tally loses its rhythm, cold and warmth encroach upon each other, and midsummer reverts to thick frost. If the golden palace fails to sprout mercury and cinnabar, then within the crucible, insects and worms arise; in great cases, mountains collapse and the earth splits, the metal tiger and wood dragon boil over; in minor cases, violent rain and whirlwinds strike, the kan male and li female flee in chaos. From this, we see that even if you recognize the two substances, lead and mercury, without understanding the fire-timing, it is all in vain.

Wang Dao says: The divine elixir of golden liquid depends entirely on the fire-timing. Fire is the parent of the medicine; the medicine is the descendant of fire.

Master Wei Lü says: For one who fully grasps the Dao of nature and destiny, nothing surpasses the Yellow Emperor’s golden elixir. The marvel of the golden elixir lies in the fire record; the marvel of the fire record lies in the mutual interaction of *kan* and *li*, generating transformation and spiritual illumination. Thus, it is clear that without the fire-timing, lead and mercury cannot form the elixir. In the past, Elder Cui transmitted to the Perfected Lü the *Heavenly Origin Mirror for Entering the Medicine*, precisely to ensure he thoroughly investigated the fire work. Scholars should devote themselves wholeheartedly to this.

28.
The *Cantong Qi* and scriptures discuss the ultimate truth,
Yet do not commit the fire-timing to writing.
To know the oral secrets that penetrate the mysterious,
You must discuss them in detail with an immortal.

Master Daoguang says: The sage transmits the medicine but not the fire; since ancient times, few have known the fire-timing. Do not treat the great Dao as child’s play—you must deliberate carefully with an immortal. Thus, the fire-timing cannot be understood unless encountered by a perfected one who transmits it mind-to-mind.

Master Wuming says: The *Fire Record* has six hundred chapters, each resembling the others, interweaving and aligning with the celestial degrees. What Heaven has concealed, the sage does not transmit—when you meet a venerable teacher, do not act recklessly.

From the third day, when the moon reveals its *geng* phase, until the first quarter on the eighth day, it resides only within the span of five or six days—is this not "advance must be brief"? Then, from the fifteenth to the twenty-third, the waning moon lingers beyond eight or nine days—is this not "retreat must be long"?

chunks.original_text: 八月十五饭蟾辉，正是金精壮盛时。 若到一阳来起复，便堪进火莫延迟。 叶士表曰：太阴月月圆满，惟八月十五最明者，太阴极也。 月为金，金旺於酉，阴极阳生，故久进火也，象日中亥末子初之时。 世人以八月十五取圭丹者，非也。 ○袁公辅曰：丹为金，金旺於酉，故至八月十五乃金水旺盛之时，为最明也。 天下之理，盛叉有衰，阳铃有阴，至十月坤卦，阴符将尽，缘阴无可绝之理，阳将生焉。 冬至起复卦，故又进火循环，接一年之候也。 丹道亦然，若能准乾坤阴阳相代之理修之，无不成者。 亥上见六，乃十月老阴之位，阴气至此方极。 六者，阴数也，且乾坤为阴阳造化之主，故七汨来复也。 建子之月，天轮左转，地轴右旋，炁交感，生於万物，明年冬至，各反其本。 故二炁言之，则是阳进而阴退也。 夏至阳气复於巳，冬至阴气复於亥，故谓之反本。 三十 一阳才动作丹时，铅鼎温温照幌帷。 受气之初容易识，抽添运用且防危。 叶士表曰：中冬至，乃夜半子时也。 真铅，鼎室之中阳炁随阳而长温温然如灯光透於帷幌之问也。 受气之初者，言其所禀也，如金胎於卯，木胎於酉，火胎於子，水土胎於午。 此虽易知，其抽添运用不可不慎也。 ○袁公辅曰：此言下手工夫也。 受气之初，其得甚易，而抽添运用，有安有危，不可不慎也。 《参同契》曰：立表以为范，占候定吉凶，发号顺时令，勿失爻动时。 ○无名子曰：一阳子时造丹鼎内真铅被火锻炼，光透帘帏。 一时中得之甚易，及乎在内却有十月之功，运用抽添，防危度险也。 三十－ 玄珠有象逐阳生，阳极阴消渐剥形。 十月霜飞丹始熟，想时神鬼也须惊。 叶士表曰：玄珠者，汞也，随阳熙而生，如月假日而明也。 阳盛则阴熙剥灭。 十月者，言丹药在鼎，如子在胞，待其数足，熟则体化纯·阳，鬼神惊伏。 《参同契》曰：类如鸡子，黑白相扶，纵横一寸，以为始初，四支五脏，筋骨乃相，涉历十月，脱出其胞。 三十二 前弦之后后弦前，药味平平气象全。
chunks.translated_text:
On the fifteenth of the eighth month, the toad’s glow fills the meal—
This is precisely when metal’s essence is at its peak.
When the first yang arises in revival,
Begin the firing without delay.

Master Yeshi Biao says: The moon of Great Yin waxes full each month, yet on the fifteenth of the eighth month it shines brightest, for this is the extreme of Great Yin. The moon is metal, and metal flourishes in *you*; when yin reaches its limit, yang is born—thus the firing is prolonged, resembling the moment between *hai*’s end and *zi*’s beginning. Those who take the cinnabar elixir on the fifteenth of the eighth month are mistaken.

Master Yuan Gongfu says: The elixir is metal, and metal flourishes in *you*; thus, by the fifteenth of the eighth month, the time of metal and water’s full vigor arrives, and it is brightest. In all under heaven, when things reach their height they must decline, and when yang reaches its peak yin arises. By the tenth month, in the *kun* hexagram, the yin tally is nearly exhausted; yet since yin cannot be utterly extinguished, yang is about to be born. At the winter solstice, the *fu* hexagram arises, and so the firing begins anew in cyclical return, aligning with the year’s celestial timing. The Dao of the elixir is no different: if one cultivates in accord with the principle of qian and kun’s alternating yin and yang, there is nothing that cannot be achieved. When six appears at *hai*—the position of old yin in the tenth month—yin qi reaches its extreme. Six is the number of yin, and since qian and kun govern the transformations of yin and yang, the seventh *gu* brings revival. In the month of *jianzi*, the celestial wheel turns left while the earth’s axis rotates right; qi intermingles and gives birth to the myriad things. By the next winter solstice, each returns to its root. Thus, in terms of the two qi, yang advances as yin retreats. At the summer solstice, yang qi revives at *si*, and at the winter solstice, yin qi revives at *hai*—hence it is called “returning to the root.”

---

As soon as the first yang stirs, the time for the elixir arrives;
The lead cauldron glows warmly, illuminating the curtains.
At the moment of receiving qi, it is easily recognized—
Yet in drawing and adding, be ever vigilant against danger.

Master Yeshi Biao says: The winter solstice occurs at midnight, the *zi* hour. True lead, within the cauldron chamber, follows the growth of yang qi, warming like a lamp’s light shining through the curtains. “At the moment of receiving qi” refers to its endowment—just as metal is gestated in *mao*, wood in *you*, fire in *zi*, and water and earth in *wu*. Though this is easily known, one must exercise caution in the work of drawing and adding.

Master Yuan Gongfu says: This speaks of the initial effort. At the moment of receiving qi, attainment is quite easy, but in the work of drawing and adding, there is both safety and peril—one must be vigilant. The *Cantong Qi* says: “Erect a gnomon as a standard, observe the signs to determine fortune or misfortune, issue commands in accord with the seasons, and never miss the moment when the lines move.”

Master Wuming says: At the *zi* hour of the first yang, within the elixir cauldron, true lead is refined by fire, its light penetrating the curtains. Obtaining it in that moment is quite easy, yet within it lies the labor of ten months—drawing and adding, guarding against danger and navigating peril.

---

The mysterious pearl takes form as yang is born,
When yang reaches its peak, yin wanes and its shape is gradually stripped away.
After ten months of frost, the elixir ripens—
At the thought of it, even gods and ghosts must tremble.

Master Yeshi Biao says: The mysterious pearl is mercury, which arises with the growth of yang, like the moon borrowing the sun’s light to shine. When yang flourishes, yin qi is worn away. “Ten months” refers to the elixir in the cauldron, like a child in the womb—once its time is complete, it matures into pure yang, and gods and ghosts submit in awe. The *Cantong Qi* says: “It resembles a chicken’s egg, black and white supporting each other, one *cun* in length and breadth as its beginning. The four limbs and five viscera, sinews and bones, all take shape. After ten months, it emerges from the womb.”

---

Between the waxing crescent and the waning crescent,
The medicine’s flavor is balanced, and its qi is whole.

chunks.original_text: 采得归来炉裹锻，锻成温养似烹鲜。 叶士表曰：前弦之后，后弦之前，桂魄澄满之时也，当此时，药熙平和，气象全足，下工探炼，而后温养。 烹鲜者，言如治小鱼也，进火不可有太过不及之息，亦不可挠之，当任其自然而熟。 老子曰：治大国，若烹小鲜是也。 ○袁公辅曰：前弦之后，后弦之前，乃十五也，此时桂魄澄满，气象全足，若人能依法太阴，自立神鼎修炼一体无异也。 盖太阴自坤变震兑而至乾阳，亦是温养而来，自柔至刚也。 进火之法，如煮小鱼相似，苟或火盛，则太刚而易炊，火缓则太柔而不能熟。 温养者，火力有节也。 ○无名子曰：初八日二阳生，名兑卦，此时魄中魂半，其平如绳，故日上弦。 前属阳，其后属阴，阴中半阳，得水中之金八两，其味平平，其气象全。 至十五日三汤以备，象乾卦，此时阴魄之水消尽，阳魂之金盈轮，是以团圆，纯阳无阴，故曰望也。 夫阳极则生阴，故十六日纯阳轮中生一阴，象巽卦，渐渐缺，至二十三日二阴生，象艮卦，此时魂中魄半，其平如绳，故日下弦。 此弦之前属阴，其后属阳，阳中阴半，得金中之水半斤，其味平平，其气象全。 故圣人喻此二八，归造化炉中烹锻，真一之炁，变成一粒吞归五内，又别运既望之火，烹煎而成金液还丹也。 修真十书悟真篇卷之二十七竟 修真十书悟真篇卷之二十八

Gathered and returned, it is forged within the furnace,
Forged and tempered, nurtured like simmering fresh fish.

Master Yeshi Biao says: Between the waxing crescent and the waning crescent—when the cassia orb is clear and full—lies the time when the medicine’s qi is balanced and whole. At this moment, the adept refines it, then proceeds to gentle nurturing. "Simmering fresh fish" means treating it like cooking small fish: the fire must neither overreach nor fall short, nor should it be disturbed. It must be left to mature naturally. As Laozi says: "Governing a great state is like cooking small fish."

Master Yuan Gongfu says: Between the waxing crescent and the waning crescent—on the fifteenth day—when the cassia orb is clear and full, its qi is whole. If one can follow the method of the Great Yin, establishing the divine crucible to refine the elixir, there will be no difference. For the Great Yin transforms from *Kun* to *Zhen* and *Dui*, ascending to the pure yang of *Qian*—this too is a process of gentle nurturing, from softness to hardness. The method of advancing the fire resembles cooking small fish: if the fire is too strong, it becomes brittle and easily scorched; if too weak, it remains soft and unripe. Gentle nurturing means regulating the fire’s intensity.

An Unknown Master says: On the eighth day, the second yang arises, forming the *Dui* hexagram. At this time, the po is half within the hun, its balance straight as a string—hence the waxing crescent. The preceding phase belongs to yang, the following to yin; within yin, half is yang, yielding eight ounces of metal within water. Its flavor is balanced, its qi whole. By the fifteenth day, the three cauldrons are prepared, symbolizing the *Qian* hexagram. Now the yin po’s water is exhausted, and the yang hun’s metal fills the wheel—thus it is full and round, pure yang without yin, hence the full moon. Yet when yang reaches its peak, yin arises: on the sixteenth day, a single yin is born within the pure yang wheel, symbolizing the *Xun* hexagram. Gradually it wanes, and by the twenty-third day, the second yin arises, symbolizing the *Gen* hexagram. At this time, the hun is half within the po, its balance straight as a string—hence the waning crescent. The preceding phase belongs to yin, the following to yang; within yang, half is yin, yielding half a catty of water within metal. Its flavor is balanced, its qi whole. Thus the sage compares these two eights, gathering them into the alchemical furnace to forge the true unity of qi, transforming it into a single grain to be swallowed into the five viscera. Then, employing the fire of the post-full-moon phase, it is simmered and refined into the Golden Liquor Returned Elixir.

chunks.original_text: 绝句下 三十三 长男乍饮西方水，少女初开北地花。 若使青娥相见后，一时关锁住黄家。 叶士表曰：此论火侯也。 震为长男，兑为少女。 巽为长女，属木，日青娥，艮坤属土，为黄家也。 言震一变为兑，神水生也，兑一变为乾，金花凝也，乾一变为巽，自巽一阴生其药，皆含护於中宫也。 ○《参同契》曰：三日震动，八日兑行，三五德就，乾体乃成。 巽继其统，固济探时，艮生进止，不得喻时。 六五坤承，清恬终始，轻春众子，世为类母。 ○袁公辅曰：长男，震卯也，为太阳。 少女，兑酉也，为太阴。 乍与初，皆始也，太阳自初一日入酉，初三日太阴便生纤魄。 北地花者，乃自阴而生阳也，震一变为兑，二变为乾，兑乾皆属金，故三日为金花初开。 青娥，木汞也，至十五圆照甲方，若太阴与甲相见之后，自此从乾变巽，复归坤位也。 真人以此喻鼎中当金水壮盛之时，正阴阳两停之际，便宜则而象之关防罗网，使真汞无所逃遗，一时之内可立就也。 正如上文云：便好用工修二八，一时辰内管丹成。 三十四 兔鸡之月及其时，刑德临门药象之。 到此金砂须沐浴，若还加火必倾危。 叶士表曰：卯酉，二八门，日月出没之所。 卯为刑，刑主杀，盖四阳之位，阴不胜阳，阴道将离，故阳道随阴而落，象金砂落在胞中也。 酉为德，二主生，盖四阴之位阳不胜阴，阳道将离，故阴气随阳而落，象金水滋液於鼎内，故《参同契》曰：二月榆死，八月麦生，当此之时，住火忽符也。 ○袁公辅曰：日月至卯酉二月，正刑德临门之时，卯酉为日月出入之门，谓至本位也。 岂非及时乎？ 日主刑杀，月主德生，二月榆死，阳中有阴，八月麦生，阴中有阳。 故太阴之魄象之。 谓上下两弦，金水炁停，到此金砂阴汞居三阴三阳之际，故沐浴也，如人休沐。 火主动，倘有所动，叉致倾危矣。 ○无名子曰：兔二月为德，鸡八月为刑，此两月号．为沐浴，当罢火，若进加火，爻反政倾危矣。 魏真人《鼎器歌》曰：首尾武，中问文。 言火侯首尾也，当晦朔用武火，中问当月望金水逾盈之际，须防变护失，故用文火也。 三十五 日月三旬一遇逢，以时易日法神功。 叶士表曰：一年有三百六十日，一月有三百六十时，真人以时易日，法天地之神功也。 日月一月一交会，此则一日一交会也，盖神也者，不疾而速，不行而至。 ○无名子日：太阴太阳一日一次相交，圣人则之，故移一月之侯在一日之中，又移一日之候分在一时辰之内，般运符火，守城则沐浴罢功，野战则龙虎交合，抽添进退，知吉知凶，虑险防危，无忽无怠，故得灵砂凝结也。 守城野战知凶吉，增和灵砂满鼎红。 叶士表曰：守城者，退火守药也。 野战者，进火探药也。 修丹之士能审察进退，知其吉凶，则丹熙不耗，日盛一日也。 ○袁公辅曰：守城者，静也，野战者，动也。 故吉凶常存於动静之问。 运符火之士，能知吉凶动静之理，则鼎内灵砂安得不成丹哉？ ○无名子曰：苟或阴阳‘错乱，日月垂戾，外火虽动而行，内符闭息不应。 有道之士进火退火，知吉知凶，旋斗历箕，暗合天度，自然灵胎密运，神鼎增辉。 三十六 否泰才交万物盈，屯蒙二卦受生成。 个中得意休求象，若究旱爻馒役情。

**Thirty-Three**
The eldest son first drinks the western waters,
The youngest daughter first blooms the northern flowers.
If the Azure Maiden should meet them thereafter,
All at once the Yellow House is sealed shut.

Master Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of the fire phases.
*Zhen* is the eldest son, *Dui* the youngest daughter.
*Xun* is the eldest daughter, belonging to wood, called the Azure Maiden.
*Gen* and *Kun* belong to earth, called the Yellow House.
It says: When *Zhen* transforms once into *Dui*, the divine water is born;
when *Dui* transforms once into *Qian*, the golden flower congeals.
When *Qian* transforms once into *Xun*, from *Xun* a single yin arises—
its medicine is all contained and guarded within the Central Palace.

The *Cantong Qi* says:
On the third day *Zhen* stirs,
On the eighth day *Dui* moves.
When the three and five virtues are complete,
The body of *Qian* is formed.
*Xun* inherits its lineage,
Firmly securing the time of refinement.
*Gen* governs advance and retreat,
Yet cannot be grasped in words.
The six and five of *Kun* uphold,
Serene and tranquil from beginning to end.
Lightly nurturing the many children,
It becomes the mother of all kinds.

Master Yuan Gongfu says:
The eldest son is *Zhen-mao*, the Greater Yang.
The youngest daughter is *Dui-you*, the Greater Yin.
"First" and "initial" both mean the beginning.
The Greater Yang enters *you* on the first day;
on the third day, the Greater Yin gives birth to a slender crescent.
The "northern flowers" arise from yin to generate yang.
When *Zhen* transforms once into *Dui*, and twice into *Qian*,
both *Dui* and *Qian* belong to metal—
thus on the third day the golden flowers first bloom.
The Azure Maiden is wood-mercury;
by the fifteenth day, it shines full upon the *jia* direction.
If the Greater Yin meets *jia* thereafter,
from *Qian* it transforms into *Xun*, then returns to the position of *Kun*.
The Perfected One uses this to illustrate that when the crucible’s metal and water are at their peak,
precisely at the moment when yin and yang are evenly balanced,
one should swiftly model the barriers and nets,
so that the true mercury has nowhere to escape—
in a single moment, it can be accomplished.
Just as the previous passage says:
"When the time comes to refine the two eights,
Within one double-hour the elixir is complete."

**Thirty-Four**
In the months of the Hare and the Rooster, at their appointed times,
Punishment and virtue arrive at the gate—such is

chunks.original_text: 叶士表曰：否泰，阴阳等也。 屯蒙，六十卦符火之首也。 朝屯暮蒙，日用两卦，两卦计十二爻，以应十二时，举一以为例也。 当阴阳两平之时，真熙盈满，屯蒙二卦生成药物。 圣人以卦符为则，不泥乎爻象也。 ○袁公辅曰：天地之熙，一交则万物丰盈，屯蒙为六十卦符火之首，屯蒙受卦，便禀生成。 真一子曰：立创鼎器，运动天机，初则全无形质，一如鸿蒙之中，既经起火，运符便应，元年滋产，日居月诸，龙虎体就是也。 苟於此中得其幽玄，不铃泥易求象索爻，徒劳神思耳。 ○无名子曰：阳熙到天地之中，阴阳相半，不寒不热而温，故为泰卦，亦如月之上弦气候也。 此时阴阳二无自然相合，故圣人於此不进火候，谓之沐浴。 至阴降天地之中，阴阳相半，不热不寒而冻，故为否卦，亦如月之下弦熙侯也。 此时阴阳二炁自然相交，圣人不进火候，亦谓之沐浴也。 若能於屯蒙否泰四卦中得意，何铃究拿爻而劳心役思哉？ 三十七 卦中设象本仪形，得象忘言意自明。 后世迷徒惟泥象，却行卦黑望飞升。 叶士表曰：圣人立卦设象，显造化万物之理，学者得象忘言可也。 锺离先生诗曰：大道安能以语通，伯阳假易作参同，后人不识神仙喻，执着荃蹄便下功。 ○袁公辅曰：圣人作易画卦，设三百八十四爻，显造化万物之理，学者得象忘言可矣，苟迷执爻象，望卦以飞升，不亦远乎？ 三十八 天地盈虚自有时，审观消息始知机。

Ye Shibiao says: *Pi* and *Tai* represent the equilibrium of yin and yang. *Zhun* and *Meng* are the first of the sixty-four hexagrams in the firing of the tally. At dawn, *Zhun*; at dusk, *Meng*—daily employing these two hexagrams, their twelve lines corresponding to the twelve double-hours, taking one as the exemplar.

When yin and yang are evenly balanced, true *qi* fills to abundance, and the *Zhun* and *Meng* hexagrams generate and complete the medicinal substances. The sage takes the hexagrams as his standard, not clinging to the images of the lines.

Master Yuan Gongfu says: When the *qi* of Heaven and Earth conjoin, all things flourish in abundance. *Zhun* and *Meng*, as the first of the sixty-four hexagrams in the firing of the tally, receive their hexagrams and thereby receive generation and completion.

True Unity Master says: In establishing the crucible and moving the celestial mechanism, at first there is no form or substance—just as in the primordial chaos. Once the fire is kindled and the tally set in motion, the first year’s growth begins, day by day and month by month, and the bodies of Dragon and Tiger take shape. If one grasps the profound mystery herein, there is no need to cling to changing images or seek out lines—such efforts only weary the spirit in vain.

The Nameless Master says: When yang *qi* reaches the center of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang are evenly matched, neither cold nor hot but temperate—this is the *Tai* hexagram, like the climate of the moon’s first quarter. At this time, the two *qi* of yin and yang naturally conjoin, so the sage does not advance the firing regimen, calling this "bathing."

When yin descends to the center of Heaven and Earth, yin and yang are evenly matched, neither hot nor cold but chilled—this is the *Pi* hexagram, like the climate of the moon’s last quarter. At this time, the two *qi* of yin and yang naturally intersect, and the sage does not advance the firing regimen, also calling this "bathing."

If one can grasp the meaning within the four hexagrams *Zhun*, *Meng*, *Pi*, and *Tai*, why cling to lines and exhaust the mind with labored thought?

**Thirty-Seven**
Hexagrams set forth images to model forms;
grasp the image, forget the words, and meaning becomes clear.
Later generations, deluded, cling only to images,
pursuing hexagrams in darkness, hoping for ascension.

Ye Shibiao says: The sages established hexagrams and set forth images to reveal the principles of the myriad things’ transformations. The scholar should grasp the image and forget the words.

Master Zhongli’s poem says:
How can the great Dao be conveyed through speech?
Bo Yang borrowed the *Yi* to compose the *Can Tong Qi*.
Later people, failing to recognize the immortals’ metaphors,
clutch at fishing baskets and snares, striving in vain.

Master Yuan Gongfu says: The sages created the *Yi*, drawing hexagrams and setting forth three hundred eighty-four lines to reveal the principles of the myriad things’ transformations. The scholar should grasp the image and forget the words. If one is deluded and clings to the images of the lines, hoping to ascend through hexagrams, is this not far from the mark?

**Thirty-Eight**
Heaven and Earth’s fullness and emptiness have their appointed times;
observe their waxing and waning to know the mechanism.

chunks.original_text: 由来庚甲申明令，杀尽三尸道可期。 叶士表曰：盈与息，阴化为阳也； 虚与消，阳化为阴也。 二者各有其时，人能审观消息盈虚之理，始知造化之机矣。 庚甲者，三日月出於庚子，五月满於甲，当此之时，探药进火，如人君申明号令，以杀伐阴鬼，真道可期也。 ○无名子曰：纯阴坤卦，冻变为寒，日冬，万物收藏之时，故曰虚也，天地盈虚，因月而见，月从日生，初三日震庚生形，初八日兑丁上弦，十五日乾甲圆满天地，盈之时也。 十六日巽辛受统，二十三日艮丙下弦，三十日坤乙消灭天地，亏之时也。 三十九 要得谷神长不死，须凭玄牝立根基。 叶士表曰：人抱真一之熙，如谷函至虚之神，虽日无形，扣之则应，若欲真无不绝，当以玄牝为根基也。 玄牝者，阴阳门户，天地之根也。 真精既返黄金室，一颗灵光永不离。 叶士表曰； 玄牝之官，即中官也，中藏真一之炁，生金精也。 真熙生产金精，复还其室，则灵光不离於己。 灵光，神也。 积精生神，世人泄之於外，所以精竭人亡也。 ○无名子曰：金精，乃华池中神水之真金也，又名金胎。 神室，乃丹田混元官，中有真一之精，在天为天一之水。 四十 玄牝之门世罕知，休将口鼻妄施为。

From of old, the *geng* and *jia* clarify the decree—
slay the Three Worms, and the Dao may be attained.

Ye Shibiao says: Fullness and growth are yin transforming into yang; emptiness and decline are yang transforming into yin. Each has its appointed time. If one can carefully observe the principles of waxing and waning, fullness and emptiness, only then does one grasp the mechanism of creation and transformation. The *geng* and *jia* refer to the third day when the moon emerges at *gengzi*, and the fifteenth when it reaches fullness at *jia*. At these times, one gathers the medicine and advances the fire, just as a ruler issues clear commands to execute yin demons—thus may the true Dao be attained.

The Nameless Master says: The pure yin of the *Kun* hexagram congeals into cold; this is winter, the season when the myriad things withdraw and store—hence it is called emptiness. Heaven and Earth’s fullness and emptiness are revealed through the moon. The moon is born from the sun: on the third day, *Zhen* at *geng* takes form; on the eighth, *Dui* at *ding* reaches the first quarter; on the fifteenth, *Qian* at *jia* fills Heaven and Earth—this is the time of fullness. On the sixteenth, *Xun* at *xin* assumes governance; on the twenty-third, *Gen* at *bing* reaches the last quarter; on the thirtieth, *Kun* at *yi* dissolves Heaven and Earth—this is the time of waning.

**Thirty-Nine**
To keep the Valley Spirit ever undying,
one must rely on the Mysterious Female to establish the root.

Ye Shibiao says: When a person embraces the true unity of radiance, it is like the valley containing the spirit of utmost emptiness—though formless, it responds when summoned. If one wishes this true emptiness never to cease, one must take the Mysterious Female as the root. The Mysterious Female is the gateway of yin and yang, the root of Heaven and Earth.

Once true essence returns to the Golden Chamber,
a single spark of numinous light will never depart.

Ye Shibiao says: The palace of the Mysterious Female is the Central Palace, which stores the true qi of the One and generates the golden essence. When true radiance produces golden essence and returns it to its chamber, the numinous light will never leave one’s self. This numinous light is the spirit. By accumulating essence, one generates spirit—yet people dissipate it outward, and so their essence is exhausted and they perish.

The Nameless Master says: Golden essence is the true gold of the divine water in the Flowery Pond, also called the Golden Embryo. The Spirit Chamber is the Primal Palace of the Cinnabar Field, which contains the true essence of the One. In Heaven, it is the Water of Heavenly One.

**Forty**
The gateway of the Mysterious Female is rarely known to the world—
do not mistakenly apply it to the mouth and nose.

chunks.original_text: 饶君吐纳经千载，争得金乌栩兔儿。 叶士表日：此一篇论根蒂也。 老子曰：谷神不死，是谓玄牝，玄牝之门，是谓天地根。 世人见门一字，遂寻其穴，有以口鼻为之，有以舌下两窍为之，有以两胜为之，有以男女为之。 盖门者，出入之谓也，人原父母一点精黑，先结为丹元，然后生五脏六腑，两肾中问，混元一穴是也，真无从此而出，及其生药，又流入於此。 《龙虎上经》曰：径寸之质以混三才。 《参同契》曰：纵横一寸，以为始初。 ○袁公辅日：玄牝之门者，日月出入之门也。 世罕有知者，若能知之，则会合阴阳，不为难耳。 ○无名子曰：玄牝之门，为天地根叶，文叔误指为两肾中问混元一穴，殊不知玄牝二物，若无此二物，安能有万物哉？ 故内外二丹从此而出，圣人秘之，号日偃月炉，悬胎鼎是也。 金乌，金丹也，金丹制己汞，如描搏鼠，如鹰捐兔，不能逃走矣。 四十一 异名同出少人知，两者玄玄是要机。 保命全形明损益，紫金丹药最灵奇。 叶士表曰：老子云，此两者同出而异名，盖论大道有无之体。 有人借乱此以论铅汞二物，铅生汞，汞生铅，是异名而同出也，可以保命，可以全形，人当明其损益也。 不明者泄之於外，故有所损。 明者宝於内，故有所益。 四十二 始之有作无人见，及至无为众始知。 但见无为为要道，岂知有作是根基。 叶士表日：有作者推排符火，烹炼丹药，无为者形神俱妙，与道合真。 ○袁公辅曰：始之有作者推排符火，烹炼丹药，岂人之所见者，及至於无为之地，谓形神俱妙，与道合真也，众始知骇也，但见无为为道之要妙，岂知有作实道之根基也欤？ 四十三 黑中有白为丹母，雄裹藏雌是圣胎。

Though you refine breath through millennia of exhalation and inhalation,

Master Ye Shibiao says: This chapter discusses the root and foundation.
Laozi said: "The valley spirit does not die—this is called the Mysterious Female. The gateway of the Mysterious Female is called the root of Heaven and Earth."
Yet when people see the word "gateway," they seek its aperture: some take it as the mouth and nose, some as the two orifices beneath the tongue, some as the two kidneys, and some as the union of male and female.
Now, a gateway is simply the place of ingress and egress. The original speck of essence from father and mother first coalesces into the cinnabar prime, then generates the five viscera and six bowels. Between the two kidneys lies the Primal Cavity of Chaos—this is where true qi emerges, and where the elixir, once produced, flows back in.
*The Scripture of Dragon and Tiger* says: "A substance of inch-square dimension unites the Three Powers."
*The Kinship of the Three* says: "A span of one inch serves as the primordial beginning."

Master Yuan Gongfu says: The gateway of the Mysterious Female is the portal through which the sun and moon enter and exit. Few in the world know this—yet if one knows it, harmonizing yin and yang becomes effortless.
The Nameless Master says: The gateway of the Mysterious Female is the root and leaf of Heaven and Earth. Master Wenshu mistakenly identified it as the Primal Cavity of Chaos between the kidneys, not realizing that the Mysterious and the Female are two distinct entities—without these two, how could the myriad things exist? Thus, both inner and outer elixirs emerge from this. The sages guarded this secret, calling it the Reclining Moon Crucible, the Suspended Embryo Cauldron.
The Golden Crow is the golden elixir. The golden elixir restrains one’s native mercury, just as one seizes a rat or as a hawk snatches a hare—it cannot escape.

**Forty-One**
Different names yet the same origin—few comprehend;
these two mysteries hold the essential mechanism.
To preserve life and perfect form, discern gain and loss—
the Purple Gold elixir is most wondrous and numinous.

Master Ye Shibiao says: Laozi said, "These two emerge from the same source yet bear different names"—this speaks of the substance of the Great Dao in its presence and absence.
Some misapply this to lead and mercury, saying lead generates mercury and mercury generates lead, thus different names from the same origin. This can preserve life and perfect form—one must discern its gains and losses.
Those who do not understand dissipate it outward and thus suffer loss; those who understand treasure it within and thus reap benefit.

**Forty-Two**
At first, when there is action, none perceive it;
only when it reaches non-action do the many recognize it.
Though all see non-action as the essential Dao,
who knows that action is the very root?

Master Ye Shibiao says: "Action" refers to the manipulation of talismanic fire in refining the elixir; "non-action" is when form and spirit are both wondrous, merging with the true Dao.
Master Yuan Gongfu says: At first, "action" involves the manipulation of talismanic fire to refine the elixir—who could witness this? Only when it reaches the state of non-action, where form and spirit are both wondrous and merge with the true Dao, do the many begin to comprehend. Though all see non-action as the essential mystery of the Dao, who knows that action is its very foundation?

**Forty-Three**
Within the black lies the white—this is the mother of the elixir;
within the male is concealed the female—this is the sacred embryo.

Forty-Four
From *having* and *not-having*, each enters the other—
how can mere imagination bring this to fruition?

Master Ye Shibiao says: Laozi speaks of the *huanghu* wherein there is substance, the *yaoming* wherein there is essence. *Huanghu* is the body of yang; *yaoming* is the body of yin. These two generate the elixir—it cannot be accomplished through visualization alone. *Having* is the central line of Kan; *not-having* is the central line of Li. Taking the solid center of the Kan position to transmute the yin within the Li palace—this is the mutual entry of *having* and *not-having*.

Forty-Five
When the Four Images converge, the mysterious body is complete;
where the Five Phases are whole, purple gold shines bright.
The embryo sheds its husk, enters the mouth—throughout the body, sacred;
countless dragons and spirits stand in awe.

Master Ye Shibiao says: "The embryo sheds its husk, enters the mouth" means that when the count is fulfilled and the elixir is formed, it ascends to the Heavenly Valley and descends into the mouth. Master Yuan Gongfu says: When the qi of the Four Images and Five Phases is fully gathered, the mysterious body is complete and purple gold shines. Master Zhenyi explains that this is the fire’s movement through the four seasons and Five Phases’ qi to nourish the divine embryo. "Shedding the husk" refers to the passage of ten months and the embryo’s emergence from the womb. "Entering the mouth" is like Lü the Perfected’s words: "At that time, one drinks the *daogui* oneself." "Throughout the body, sacred" means form and spirit are both wondrous, merging with the Dao in truth. At this moment, how could dragons and spirits not be struck with awe?

Forty-Six
Having drunk from the Flowery Pool, the moon congeals its radiance;
riding a golden dragon, one visits the Purple Tenuity.
Master Ye Shibiao says: The Flowery Pool is the primordial cauldron of the elixir. The medicine, originally the qi of the Great Yin, gathers in the cauldron like the moon congealing its radiance. "Riding a golden dragon" speaks of the embryo’s divine transformation, ascending in flight to pay homage to the Purple Tenuity. From then on, after the immortals recognize one,
the tides of the sea and the shifting of mountains and valleys submit to change.

Master Ye Shibiao says: This speaks of the body’s sanctification throughout.

Forty-Seven
To know the method of the Golden Liquor and Returned Elixir,
one must plant the seed in one’s own garden.
No need for forced breath or effort—
naturally, the elixir ripens and the true embryo sheds its husk.

Master Ye Shibiao says: The "garden" is oneself. First, one obtains the true lead, the mother of the medicine, to serve as the seed within. Then, using the natural numbers of heaven and earth, one generates the numinous mercury, coalescing the true embryo. Master Yuan Gongfu says: The Golden Liquor and Returned Elixir cannot be achieved through external medicine alone—it is within oneself. As Lü the Perfected says: "The Sevenfold Returned Elixir lies in refining oneself and awaiting the proper time." One must obtain the true lead, the mother of the medicine, to serve as the seed within. Then, using the natural true fire, one refines and generates the numinous mercury, coalescing the true embryo.

Forty-Eight
In vain one applies cunning and false effort—
recognize instead the deathless method of another’s household.

chunks.original_text: 壶内旋添留命酒，鼎中收取返魂浆。 叶士表曰：此药可以返人之魂、留人之命也。 ○袁公辅曰：护施奸巧诈伪之衍，法丹道愈远而有真不死之方，须细认也。 酒与浆，乃鼎中之金水，可以返魂夺命也。 四十九 雪山一味好酝酬，倾人束阳造化炉。 若过昆仑西北去，张骞方得见麻姑。 叶士表曰：白色言其色，酝酬言其味。 自泥丸降而倾入阳炉之中，造化也，若过自昆仑，然后匹配，如古张骞乘搓自黄河逆上，至天河女宿之度矣。 西北，天门也。 ○袁公辅曰：此言西方金水投束方木火，阴取阳也。 若复自乾坎西北而去，则阳后见阴也。 本是金生水，木生火，如三五一生成之数，聚集於中官戊己之位便是，今如此论者，正合逆为丹用之旨。 五十 不识阳精及主宾，知他那个是疏亲。 房中空闭尾闲穴，恨杀阎浮多少人。 叶士表曰：阳精，太阳流珠也。 主宾，铅汞也。 疏者可去，亲者可学也。 学道者既不识阳精及为主为宾者，又奚知何者可疏何者可亲哉？ 及有流入於三峰御女之卫，传习不绝，往往至死而不悟邪正，乌可不辨邪？ 锺离先生曰：修真不识祖来根，错用身心向外寻，堪叹三峰黄谷子，浮生侯杀几多人。 ○无名子曰：阳精是真一之精。 至阳之黑，号曰阳丹。 己之真熙属阴，为一身之主，以养百骸。 及阳丹自外来，以制己之阴汞，即是阳丹反为主，而己汞反为宾矣。 二物相恋结为金砂，自然不飞不走，然后加火锻成金液还丹也。 故阳丹在外，谓之疏，己之阴熙在内，谓之亲，反此亲疏，以定宾主，即道成矣。 五十一 万物芸芸各返根，返根复命即长存。 知常返本人难会，妄作招凶众所闻。 袁公辅曰：万物之滋茂，与夫草木之生植，未有不返其根者，苟或不然，何以能凋发荣枯乎？ 人能返本还元，即长存矣。 叶文叔曰：常者，自然也。 老子曰； 不能常，妄作凶。 五十二
chunks.translated_text:
Within the flask, ever replenish the Wine of Life;
In the crucible, gather the Elixir of Returned Souls.
Master Ye Shibiao says: This medicine can restore a person’s soul and preserve their life.
Master Yuan Gongfu says: Guard against cunning deceit and false practices, for the farther one strays from the Dao of the Elixir, the more one must discern the true method of deathlessness. The wine and elixir are the golden water within the crucible, capable of restoring the soul and seizing life.

Forty-Nine
A fine brew from Snow Mountain’s peak,
Poured into the Yang Crucible of Creation’s forge.
Should one pass beyond Kunlun to the northwest,
Only then would Zhang Qian meet Ma Gu.
Master Ye Shibiao says: "White" describes its color; "fermented brew" describes its taste. From the Mud Pill Palace it descends, then pours into the Yang Crucible—this is the work of Creation. If one passes beyond Kunlun, only then does matching occur, just as the ancient Zhang Qian rode a raft up the Yellow River to the Celestial River’s constellation of the Weaving Maiden. The northwest is the Gate of Heaven.
Master Yuan Gongfu says: This speaks of the Metal-Water of the West merging with the Wood-Fire of the East, yin seizing yang. If one proceeds further from Qian and Kan toward the northwest, then yang will follow and yin appear. Fundamentally, Metal generates Water, Wood generates Fire—like the numbers of the Three and Five uniting as One. When gathered at the central palace of wu-ji, this is precisely the principle of reversing the sequence for elixir use.

Fifty
Not knowing the yang essence or host and guest,
How can one discern near from far?
In vain they seal the Gate of Tail and idle the Cavern,
Cursing the multitudes of Jambudvīpa.
Master Ye Shibiao says: The yang essence is the flowing pearl of Great Yang. Host and guest are lead and mercury. What is distant may be discarded; what is near may be cultivated. Those who practice the Dao, failing to recognize the yang essence or distinguish host from guest, how can they know what to discard and what to embrace? Some flow into the arts of the Three Peaks and the Jade Maiden, passing down these practices without cease, often dying without ever discerning right from wrong—how can this not be distinguished?
Master Zhongli says: Cultivating the Real without knowing the root of one’s origin, mistakenly directing body and mind outward in search—how lamentable are the Yellow Valley adepts of the Three Peaks, how many they have led to ruin in this floating life!
An Anonymous Master says: The yang essence is the essence of the True One. The blackness of utmost yang is called the Yang Elixir. One’s own true mercury belongs to yin and serves as the master of the body, nourishing the hundred limbs. When the Yang Elixir arrives from without to restrain one’s yin mercury, the Yang Elixir becomes the host, and one’s own mercury becomes the guest. The two substances, longing for each other, congeal into golden sand, naturally neither flying nor fleeing. Then, with the addition of fire, they are forged into the Golden Liquor Returned Elixir. Thus, the Yang Elixir from without is called distant, while one’s own yin mercury within is called near. Reversing this near and far to determine host and guest—this is how the Dao is accomplished.

Fifty-One
The ten thousand things flourish, each returning to its root;
Returning to the root and recovering life—this is enduring.
Knowing the constant and returning to the origin is rarely grasped;
Acting recklessly invites misfortune, as all have heard.
Master Yuan Gongfu says: The luxuriant growth of the ten thousand things, like the sprouting of grasses and trees, is nothing that does not return to its root. If it were otherwise, how could they wither, flourish, and decay? If one can return to the origin and revert to the primordial, one endures. Master Ye Wenshu says: The constant is the natural. Laozi says: "Not knowing the constant, reckless action brings misfortune."

Fifty-Two

Forty-Eight

chunks.original_text: 欧冷亲传铸剑方，莫耶金水配柔刚。 炼成便会知人意，万里诛妖一电光。 叶士表曰：欧治合和金水，配合柔刚，铸成宝剑。 真人喻修丹之士亦以金水合和也。 丹成逆知＇未来，邪不能近也。 ○袁公辅曰：右一章，真人以欧冶铸剑为喻，予之铸剑也，合和金水，配匹柔刚，炼成坚利，飞以击物，莫不吹毛断铁。 修丹亦以金水和合，丹成逆知未来，飞腾变化，无不如意，故能扫荡妖氛，虽千里之遥，如一电光之顷也。 五十三 敲竹唤龟吞玉芝，鼓琴招凤饮刀圭。 近来透体金光现，不与常人话此规。 叶士表曰：敲竹，息气也。 黑龟，水也。 鼓琴，运两弦也。 赤凤，火也。 息一气起水以吞玉芝，运两弦起火以饮刀圭，丹成则金光透体，此法难与常人说也。 玉芝即玉液也，刀圭者，二土为圭，即坎离之戊己，刀者言二物皆为金耳。 ○无名子曰：敲竹，乃两物相击之义。 鼓琴，乃正音声诗和之义。 龙之弦熙日玉芝，虎之弦熙日刀圭。 此言龙虎相交，击而结为夫妇，如琴瑟之谐和也。 凤者南方朱雀也。 龙虎二物相交，炼成金丹，即时探取，饵归丹田，制以阴汞，然后虚心运火，忘情谐和，运阴阳合乎呼吸，以呼吸用神气，以神气取水火，以水火炼胎息，胎息绵绵，游泳坎离，坎离交媾而生金液也。 凡运火之际，忽觉夹脊｀真黑上冲泥丸，沥沥然有声从，头似有物触上脑，须突，如鸡卯颗颗自将下重楼，如汞酥香甜，甘美之味无比。 觉有此状，乃得金液还丹。 徐徐咽归丹田，常常不绝，五脏清虚，闭目内 观，脏腑历历如照烛。 然以有万道金光出体，盘旋罩身也。 五十四 药逢气类方成象，道合希夷即自然。 一粒金丹吞入腹，始知我命不由天。 袁公辅曰：月因日以能明，故道自希夷中得之。 五十五 赫赤金丹一日成，古仙垂语实堪听。 若言九载三年者，尽是推延款日程。 真一子曰：日服一粒，状如黍米，则知一日有一日之丹也。 譬如今人服药，但久而见功也。 ○袁公辅曰； 金丹之道，苟传得其真，识虎龙之交差媾，晓火候之抽添，二物俱备分毫不则一日之内便政赫然。 故彭真人云：一日可以夺四千二百二十年天地正熙。 此古仙实语，审详不诳。 若真信旁门之衍，虽积累岁月，终不能成也。
chunks.translated_text:
Ouhleng’s secret transmission of the sword-forging method,
Moye’s metal and water blend the yielding and the firm.
Once refined, it responds to human intent—
A thousand miles to slay demons in a flash of lightning.

Master Ye Shibiao says: Ouye harmonized metal and water, balancing the yielding and the firm to forge the sacred sword. The Perfected One likens the alchemist’s work to this: metal and water must also be harmonized. When the elixir is complete, one knows the future in reverse, and evil cannot draw near.

○ Master Yuan Gongfu says: In this chapter, the Perfected One uses Ouye’s sword-forging as a metaphor. Just as one forges a sword by harmonizing metal and water, matching the yielding with the firm, tempering it to hardness and sharpness, so that when swung it severs all things—cutting hair and cleaving iron—so too does the alchemist harmonize metal and water. When the elixir is complete, one knows the future in reverse, soaring and transforming at will, sweeping away demonic vapors. Though a thousand miles distant, it is as swift as a flash of lightning.

Fifty-Three
Strike bamboo to summon the tortoise to swallow the jade fungus,
Pluck the zither to call the phoenix to drink the knife-point elixir.
Lately, a golden light shines through the body—
This principle is not spoken of to ordinary men.

Master Ye Shibiao says: Striking bamboo stills the breath. The black tortoise is water. Plucking the zither moves the two strings. The red phoenix is fire. Still the breath to raise water and swallow the jade fungus; move the two strings to raise fire and drink the knife-point elixir. When the elixir is complete, golden light shines through the body—this method cannot be explained to ordinary men. The jade fungus is the jade liquid; the knife-point refers to the two earths of Kan and Li, the wu and ji of the trigrams. The "knife" signifies that both substances are metal.

○ The Nameless One says: Striking bamboo signifies the meeting of two things. Plucking the zither signifies the harmony of proper sound and poetry. The flourishing of the dragon’s string is called the jade fungus; the flourishing of the tiger’s string is called the knife-point elixir. This speaks of the dragon and tiger uniting, striking together to become husband and wife, like the harmony of zither and lute. The phoenix is the Vermilion Bird of the South. When the dragon and tiger unite and the golden elixir is refined, it is immediately gathered and ingested into the cinnabar field. Governed by yin mercury, one then empties the mind to move the fire, forgetting emotion to achieve harmony. Moving yin and yang in accord with breath, using breath to employ spirit and qi, using spirit and qi to gather water and fire, using water and fire to refine the embryo-breath—when the embryo-breath is continuous, swimming between Kan and Li, Kan and Li unite to generate the golden liquid. During the firing process, one suddenly feels the true fire rushing upward along the spine to the Mud Pill Palace, with a rushing sound in the head, as if something touches the brain. The niwan suddenly bulges, like chicken eggs descending the "tower of many stories," like mercury—smooth, fragrant, sweet, and incomparably delicious. When this state is felt, the golden liquid return-elixir is achieved. Slowly swallow it into the cinnabar field, continuously and without cease. The five viscera become clear and empty; closing the eyes, one inwardly observes the organs and bowels as if illuminated by a candle. Then, myriad golden lights emerge from the body, coiling and shrouding the form.

Fifty-Four
The medicine meets its qi-class to take form;
The Dao accords with the subtle and formless to become natural.
A single grain of golden elixir swallowed into the belly—
Only then does one know that my life is not ruled by Heaven.

Master Yuan Gongfu says: The moon borrows the sun’s light to shine; thus the Dao is attained within the subtle and formless.

Fifty-Five
The radiant golden elixir is completed in a day—
The ancient immortals’ words are truly worth heeding.
Those who speak of nine years or three years
Are merely procrastinating to extend their days.

Master Zhenyi says: Ingesting one grain, like a millet seed, one knows that each day yields its own elixir. It is like people taking medicine today—only with time does it show effect.

○ Master Yuan Gongfu says: The Way of the golden elixir, if one receives its true transmission, understands the union of tiger and dragon, and grasps the firing times of withdrawal and addition, with both substances perfectly prepared—then in a single day it blazes forth. Thus Peng the Perfected One said: "In a single day, one can seize the primordial qi of 4,220 years from Heaven and Earth." These are the true words of the ancient immortals, carefully considered and not deceptive. If one truly believes in the teachings of side doors, though years accumulate, one will never succeed.

chunks.original_text: ○无名子曰； 金丹大药，下工不逾半个时辰，立心服饵，而此言一日者，促一年熙候於一日之中也。 复以一日作用，移在一个时辰之内，故通言一日也。 五十六 大药修之有易难，也知由我亦由天。 若非积行施功德，动有群魔作障绿。 叶士表日：易者，言事之在难，难者，官成之在．天。 古之神仙，爻有大施功德，然后可成也。 五十七 三才相盗食其时，此是神仙道德机。 万化既安诸虑息，百骸俱理证无为。 《阴符经》曰：天地，万物之盗。 万物，天之盗。 人，万物之盗。 三盗既宜，三才既变，故日：食其时，百骸理，动其机，万化安。 五十八 阴符宝字逾三百，道德灵文止五千。 今古上仙无限数，尽於此处达真诠。 袁公辅日：阴符道理，乃黄老所撰，传留后世，其玄奥细微之旨，备写於中，自时厌后，超几达圣，奚皆不出於《阴符》《道德》之旨也。 五十九 饶君聪慧过颜闵，不遇师传莫强猜。
chunks.translated_text:
○ Master Wuming says: The great medicine of the golden elixir—an inferior practitioner may complete it in less than half a *shi*, yet with focused intent and ingestion, this "single day" refers to compressing a year’s firing times into one day. Further condensing a day’s work into a single *shi*, thus it is commonly called "a single day."

56.
The great medicine’s cultivation may be easy or difficult—
Know that it depends on both myself and Heaven.
Without accumulated merit and virtuous deeds,
Demonic obstacles will surely arise in droves.

Master Ye Shibiao says: "Easy" speaks to human effort; "difficult" speaks to Heaven’s decree. The immortals of old all performed great meritorious deeds before attaining success.

57.
The Three Powers plunder one another in their time—
This is the mechanism of immortals’ Dao and virtue.
When the myriad transformations settle and all concerns cease,
The hundred bones are ordered, and non-action is realized.

The *Yinfu Jing* says: Heaven and Earth plunder the myriad things; the myriad things plunder Heaven and Earth; humans plunder the myriad things. When the three plunderings are harmonized, the Three Powers transform—thus it is said: "plundering in their time," "the hundred bones ordered," "activating the mechanism," and "the myriad transformations at peace."

58.
The *Yinfu Jing*’s treasured words exceed three hundred;
The *Daode Jing*’s numinous scripture stops at five thousand.
Immortals past and present are without number,
Yet all attain the true principle within these texts.

Master Yuan Gongfu says: The principles of the *Yinfu Jing* were composed by the Yellow Emperor and Laozi, transmitted to later generations. Its profound and subtle essence is fully expounded therein. From that time onward, those who transcend the ordinary and reach sagehood have never strayed from the purport of the *Yinfu Jing* and *Daode Jing*.

59.
Though your wisdom surpasses Yan [Hui] and Min [Sun],
Without a master’s transmission, do not force guesswork.
